title: devil_may_cry_(netflix)
body: [[Netflix]] series based off of the [[Devil May Cry (series)|]] franchise.

title: devil_may_cry_(series)
body:
[b]Devil May Cry[/b] is a series of five hack and slash video games. The series was developed by [[Capcom]] and created by Kamiya Hideki.

Originally intended to be a sequel in Capcom's [[Resident Evil]] series, Devil May Cry was such a radical departure from the series' style that it was developed into a new property entirely. The series is set in a modern world, and centers on main character [[Dante (devil may cry)|Dante's]] goal of avenging his mother's murder by exterminating demons.

The gameplay consists of heavy combat scenes in which the player must attempt to extend long chains of attacks while avoiding damage in order to exhibit stylized combat; this element along with time and amount of items collected and used are taken under consideration when grading the player's performance.

* [[dante_(devil_may_cry)|Dante]]

title: jiangshi
body:
A Chinese [[undead]]. Often called a "Chinese hopping [[vampire]]".

They drain people's life energy, hence the "vampire" denomination, although they are more similar in concept to Western [[zombie|zombies]].  

They usually have fulu or [[ofuda]] (strips of paper) stuck to their foreheads. Modern iterations are often seen wearing a rimmed round hat known as a [[qingdai guanmao]], referencing how Chinese officials under the Qing Empire were viewed as bloodthirsty creatures with little regard for humanity.

Some common depictions are [[Qiqi (genshin impact)|]], [[Bongun]], [[Munak]], [[Hsien-ko]] and [[Miyako Yoshika]].

h4. See also

* [[undead]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Jiangshi":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jiangshi

title: tengen_toppa_gurren_lagann
body:
A 2007 original [[super robot]] [[mecha]] anime series animated by [[Gainax]] and co-produced by [[Aniplex]] and [[Konami]]. Best known for its over-the-top plot, action sequence, along with its ridiculously huge mecha.

h4. Plot summary

In the distant future, people build their homes and raise domestic animals in subterranean caverns. As a result, they live in fear of the occasional earthquake and cave-in, and have been for hundreds of years. Jeeha is one such village.

One day, a boy named [[Simon (ttgl)|]] happens to find a small, shiny drill while digging to expand the village. At the same time, [[Kamina (ttgl)|]], a guy who believes that there is another land above the village, persuades a gangster to break through the ceiling in order to leave the cavern. Suddenly, an earthquake occurs and the ceiling collapses, followed by a big [[robot]] breaking through the ceiling.

Kamina is now sure that there is a world above them. Recklessly, he begins to fight against the robot. At that moment, another person appears from the land above. It is a girl by the name of [[Yoko Littner|Yoko]]. With a [[rifle]] in hand, she had been tracking the robot. However, all she could do was distract it. Then, Simon shows what he had found to Kamina and Yoko. It's a mysterious robot whose head is also its body.

h4. Main Characters

title: alex_ross
body:
American painter and veteran expert artist notable for his very [[realistic]] depictions of [[comic]] and anime characters using only [[traditional media]] techniques. He uses mostly [[painting_(medium)|painting]]s.

Has created very popular [[cover]] art for both [[Marvel]] and [[DC Comics]] series, as well as the American releases of Japanese anime like [[Gatchaman]] and [[Hyakujuu-ou Golion]]. And he also did some illustrations for the opening credits of [[Spider-Man 2]].

title: world's_edge
body:
An [[in-universe location]] from [[Apex Legends]]. World's Edge is the second map, added to the game in Season 3. It is located on the planet Talos, and is near the village where [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]] grew up. It is also the location where [[Revenant (apex legends)|]] killed Forge before joining the games himself.

There are Town Takeovers based on [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]]  and [[Rampart (apex legends)|]] on the map, and it was temporarily home to the [[Mirage (apex legends)|]] Voyage.

h4. See also

title: settsuno_kirimaru
body:
A character in [[Rakudai Ninja Rantarou]].

Kirimaru is a 1st year student from the Ha-class in Ninjutsu Academy and one of a main protagonist in Nintama Rantarou. He is an orphan who lost his family and home during a war. He lives with [[Doi Hansuke|Doi-sensei]] when school isn't in session.

He usually wears dark blue scarf on both in his uniform and casual. In his casual, he has red orange sleeves with yellow at the top and dark blue pants.

Voiced by [[Tanaka Mayumi]].

title: howto:flag
body:
If you believe a post either violates the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]] or is low quality, you may flag it for review. To flag a post, click the "Flag" link under the [b]Options[/b] heading in the sidebar to the left of the post.

Flagging a post sends it to the [[about:mod queue|moderation queue]] for review. The post has three days to be reviewed by "the approval team":/users?commit=Search&search%5Blevel%5D=37 If the post is not reapproved after three days, the post will be deleted. This process is the same process that new uploads undergo.

Just because a post is flagged does not mean it will be deleted. Anyone may flag a post for any reason. A flagged post will only be deleted if no one on "the approval team":/users?commit=Search&search%5Blevel%5D=%3E=37 chooses to reapprove it after three days.

Please keep your flags civil and follow the [[help:community rules|community rules]] when flagging.

h4. Guidelines

Do flag the following content:

* Low quality or [[off-topic]] content.
* Content that breaks the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]].

Do not flag the following content:

* Objectionable content that does not violate the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]], such as [[loli]], [[shota]], [[guro]], [[rape]] or [[bestiality]].
* [[Duplicate]]s. [[help:post relationships|Parent]] them to their superior posts instead.
* [[Paid reward]]s or [[banned artist]]s. Request a ban in topic #10525 instead.
* Mistagged posts.

h4#restrictions. Flagging Restrictions

* A user can only flag a post once. 
* Flaggers are anonymous to everyone except Moderators. If the uploader of the flagged post is a Moderator, the flagger is anonymous to them too.
* Users can only flag up to 5 posts every 3 days.
* "Approvers":[/users?commit=Search&search%5Blevel%5D=>=37] can flag an unlimited number of posts. 

h4#related. See also

* [[about:mod queue]]
* [[howto:appeal]]
* {{status:flagged}}
* "List of flagged posts":/post_flags

title: oda_nobunaga_(swimsuit_berserker)_(fate)
body:
[[Oda Nobunaga (fate)|Oda Nobunaga]] as a Berserker-class servant in [i][[Fate/Grand Order]][/i], debuting in the 2017 Summer event. Her weapon looks like an [[oversized object|oversized]] [[guitar]], owing to her moniker as the Dai[b]ROCK[/b]uten Maoh, and her Noble Phantasm is [b]NOBUNAGA THE ROCK'N ROLL[/b].

As an aside, much like [[Elizabeth Bathory (Brave) (Fate)|Brave Liz]], a lot of her attacks contain references to other media, such as [[Hokuto no Ken]] and [[Dragon Ball]].

[b]Do not add the [[Oda Nobunaga (Koha-Ace)]] tag if Nobunaga Swimsuit Berserker is by herself, as they are treated as separate characters. Only tag them together if they are both present in the image, or one is [[cosplay]]ing as the other.[/b]

title: nishinoya_yuu
body:
Nishinoya Yū is a character from [[Haikyuu!!]]
He is a second-year student at Karasuno High School. He serves as the libero for the school's [[volleyball]] team and is referred to by his teammates as "Karasuno's Guardian Deity" for his remarkable skills.

Nishinoya is the shortest member of the team, standing at 159.3 cm. He regularly styles his wild [[black hair]] by ruffling most of it upwards. He has [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[colored bangs]] and his eyes are [[brown eyes|brown]] and slanted.

Voiced by [[Okamoto Nobuhiko]].

h4. Related tags
* [[volleyball uniform]], [[spiked hair]]

title: ishtar_(swimsuit_rider)_(fate)
body:
[[ishtar (fate)|Ishtar]]'s swimsuit version for the [[Dead Heat Summer Race!|summer 2017 event]]. She is a welfare Servant obtained from the event, so her outfit does not change with Ascension levels. She wears a [[pink jacket]] that completely covers up her swimsuit, which she states is a [[white one-piece swimsuit]], as is slightly more visible in her final ascension art (in addition to a [[black bow]] at the top). [[Official art]] released in 2024 revealed that it is [[strapless]].

She switches to two different outfits during her [[Noble Phantasm (fate)|]] animation, a [[blue kimono]] and a [[blue dress]].

title: science
body:
Any branch of study related to factual truths and principles. Likewise, it can be used to discover any facts that have not been uncovered yet using current systematic methods such as hypothesizing, observing, experimenting, measuring, and formulating laws to describe these facts.

There are numerous branches of science, and countless tools used to discover and/or prove these facts. Different scientific branches include [[math]]ematics, [[chemistry]], [[astronomy]], biology, engineering, medicine, social sciences, and physics, to name a few.

Only apply this tag if specific scientific knowledge or fact were referenced, as well as when the post is explaining certain scientifically process/theory.

title: re:zero_kara_hajimeru_isekai_seikatsu
body: In English, Re:Zero – Starting Life in Another World. A light novel series written by Nagatsuki Tappei with illustrations by [[Ootsuka Shin'ichirou]]. An anime adaptation by [i]White Fox[/i] aired in Spring 2016 with a season 2 that followed Summer 2020 & Winter 2021. Follows a boy named [[Natsuki Subaru]] as he dies and gets trapped in a fantasy world, only to discover that he can come back from the dead at certain "checkpoints", though they change randomly. What seemingly starts off as a generic 'character ends up in a parallel world' plot changes quickly. h4. Characters h5. title: berga_giros
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in the [[Gundam F91]] anime film from 1991.

[b]XM-05 Berga Giros[/b]

A high-end [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by the [[Crossbone Vanguard]]. Intended to be used by commanders, the Berga Giros was slightly reduced in size compared to its predecessor units but made up for it with more shelf nozzles for added mobility and a beefed up reactor capable of generating more power than even the SNRI's fearsome [[f91_gundam|Gundam F91]]. 

It was chiefly piloted by the Black Vanguard's captain, [[Zabine Chareux]], who had his painted in the traditional black and lilac and sported a couple radio antennae and a custom [[Shot Lancer]] with extra machine guns on it.

title: hololive_english
body:
[[hololive]]'s English-language branch, launched in August 2020.

h4. List of Members

h5. hololive English -Myth- ([i]a.k.a.[/i] [[holoMyth]])
Debuted in September 2020.
* [[Ninomae Ina'nis]] "Ina"
* [[Takanashi Kiara]]
* [[Watson Amelia]] "Ame" (inactive since October 2024)
* [[Mori Calliope]] "Calli"
* [[Gawr Gura]] (graduated May 2025)

h5. hololive English -Promise- ([i]a.k.a.[/i] [[holoPromise]] [i]or[/i] CouncilRyS)
Officially merged as "Promise" in August 2023, but had already been a well-known unofficial group under the "CouncilRyS" name ever since Sana's graduation.
h6. Project: HOPE Vsinger
Debuted in July 2021.
* [[IRyS (hololive)|]]

h6. hololive English -Council- ([i]a.k.a.[/i] [[holoCouncil]])
Debuted in August 2021.
* [[Tsukumo Sana]] (graduated July 2022)
* [[Ceres Fauna]] (graduated January 2025)
* [[Ouro Kronii]]
* [[Nanashi Mumei]] (graduated April 2025)
* [[Hakos Baelz]] "Bae"

h5. hololive English -Advent- ([i]a.k.a.[/i] [[holoAdvent]])
Debuted in July 2023.
* [[Shiori Novella]] "Shiorin"
* [[Koseki Bijou]] "Biboo"
* [[Nerissa Ravencroft]] "Rissa"
* [[Fuwawa Abyssgard]]
* [[Mococo Abyssgard]]

h5. hololive English -Justice- ([i]a.k.a.[/i] [[holoJustice]])
Debuted in June 2024.
* [[Elizabeth Rose Bloodflame]] "Liz"/"ERB"
* [[Gigi Murin]] "GG"
* [[Raora Panthera]]
* [[Cecilia Immergreen]] "Ceci"/"CC"

h5. Other

* [[Tsukumo San]], [[Ceres Faun]], [[Ouro Krono]], [[Nanashi Muman]], and [[Hayko]] - [[Genderswap]]ped versions of Council that appeared in a stream on January 25th, 2022.

h6. Unofficial

[[Akai Haato]] is sometimes jokingly referred to as "hololive English Gen 0", due to being the most capable English speaker in hololive's original Japanese branch (after [[Kiryu Coco]], who retired in July 2021). This is exacerbated by her frequent collaboration streams with hololiveEN members, and her insistent use of the hashtag "hololiveEN" in the titles and descriptions of her videos even when she's not collaborating.

h6. Staff
* [[Omega Alpha]] - an avatar of the holoEN's staff team with unique design
* [[Enma-chan]] - the [[real life insert|real life]] manager of Ina. Received a character design created by Ina.
* [[Kumomane]] - another manager of Ina. Tweeted on her behalf during a hiatus in October 2024.
* [[Jenma-chan]] - the real life manager of Gura, Amelia, and Kiara. Received a character design created by Kiara.
* [[J-chad]] - the real life manager of Calliope. Received a character design created by Calliope.

h6.  Mascots
See [[List of hololive mascots]]

h4. See also
* [[Mythbreakers (hololive english)|]]: holoMyth's all-member [[World of Darkness]] campaign hosted by [[Mori Calliope]] with the other four girls as players.
* [[Enigmatic Recollection]]: a modded [[Minecraft]] roleplay and accompanying multimedia project, starring the full EN branch from Myth to Justice.

h4. External links

* "hololive English YouTube channel":https://www.youtube.com/@hololiveEnglish
* "Hololive Production English Twitter: @hololive_En":[https://twitter.com/hololive_En]

title: x-men
body:
A comic book franchise owned and published by [[Marvel]].

[[Marvel|Set in a world]] where a race of humans, dubbed "mutants", that are born with superhuman abilities that manifest during puberty (sometimes at birth), coexists with normal humans. Due to several mutants exploiting their powers for sinister purposes, the world of X-Men is predominantly ruled by anti-mutant leaders who seeks to exterminate all mutants, along with social discrimination against them not dissimilar to racism.

The franchise centered around the eponymous "X-Men" organization founded by  [[Charles Xavier|Prof. Charles Francis Xavier]], who seeks to unite all benevolent mutants to combat the villianous mutants in hope of creating the world where both humans and mutants can peacefully coexists.

title: the_sword_in_the_stone
body:
The Sword in the Stone is a 1963 American animated musical fantasy comedy film produced by Walt Disney and released by Buena Vista Distribution. It is based on the novel of the same name by T. H. White, first published in 1938 and then revised and republished in 1958 as the first book of White's Arthurian tetralogy The Once and Future King. Directed by Wolfgang Reitherman, the film features the voices of Rickie Sorensen, Karl Swenson, Junius Matthews, Sebastian Cabot, Norman Alden, and Martha Wentworth. It was the last animated film from Walt Disney Productions to be released in Walt Disney's lifetime.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sword_in_the_Stone_(1963_film)

title: ou-sama_no_propose
body:
[[Kuozaki Saika]]. The witch who continued to save the world facing apocalyptic events once in 300 hours, and the head of an academy that magicians attend.

"--- To you, I entrust this world---"

And -- the first love girl, who passed on her body and power to [[Kuga Mushiki]] and died. In order to not get exposed by anybody as Saika, Mushiki was instructed by Saika's servant [[Karasuma Kuroe]] to attend the academy, but... Feared by classmates and even teachers, he was receiving a turbulent lifestyle where he received advice on how liking the older brother comes from a reunited younger sister.

"Be quiet. Your arm will go out of control. -- Rather, your mouth will, should I say"

Furthermore, if he's careless, in order to return to being a male, a kiss from a female is absolutely necessary!?

The duo of "DATE A LIVE" will spark this new generation strongest first love!

h4. Characters

title: vei_(vtuber)
body:
Polish-British [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. Previously an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] heavily associated with [[VShojo]], she formally joined the group on April 9, 2021, until leaving to return being an indie on April 26, 2023. Originally streamed with [[3D]] models by [[jjinomu]], switched to also using a [[Live2D]] model with her fourth costume after joining VShojo. She is the (non-IRL) significant other to [[Silvervale]], having married to each other in [[Final Fantasy XIV]] in February 2021.

She spends a lavish portion of her income to commission lewd arts of herself and her friends, resulting in a great number of posts on the site.

title: tolkien's_legendarium
body:
A series of high [[fantasy]] novels written by J. R. R. Tolkien that chronicles the history of the "Middle-earth". The series, particularly [i][[The Lord of the Rings]][/i] has became so influential that it codified numerous elements that can be commonly found in fantasy works today.

h4. Installments

* [[The Hobbit]]
* [[The Lord of the Rings]]
* [[The Silmarillion]]

h4. Licensed spinoffs

Works made under license from the Tolkien Estate or Middle-earth Enterprises after J. R. R. Tolkien's death.
* [[Middle-earth: Shadow of War]]
* [[Rings of Power]]
* [[The War of the Rohirrim]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tolkien's legendarium":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tolkien%27s_legendarium]

title: vei_(vtuber)_(4th_costume)
body:
The 4th costume and 1st L2D model of [[Vei (VTuber)|Veibae]], debuting in April 2021. Adopting a succubus appearance, this costume went through several design changes before arriving in its final form (firstly as post #4115862 and secondly as post #4154079). It's illustrated by [[Neonbeat]] and rigged by [[Keffiy]], with its 3D model being made by [[TheArtgun]] (post #4496441).

Going for a [[demon girl|succubus]] [[maid]] appearance, she wears a [[black dress|black]] & [[white dress|white]] [[short dress|short]] [[frilled dress]], [[black gloves|black]] & [[white gloves]], [[black thighhighs|black]] & [[white thighhighs]] and [[black footwear|black]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[ankle boots]].

title: wcdonald's
body:
A common [[brand name imitation]] for the [[McDonald's]] fast food chain, commonly found in various Japanese media. It is typically done by turning the yellow M logo of McDonald's upside down to create a W, hence the name.

It eventually became an official brand co-opted by McDonald's themselves for an anime-themed international advertising campaign in Spring 2024.

title: the_cleveland_show
body:
The Cleveland Show is an American adult animated sitcom created by Seth MacFarlane, Richard Appel, and Mike Henry for the Fox Broadcasting Company. A spin-off of [[Family Guy]], and the second television series in the franchise, the series centers on [[Cleveland Brown]], his new wife [[Donna Tubbs|Donna Tubbs-Brown]], and their children Cleveland Brown Jr., [[Roberta Tubbs]], and Rallo Tubbs. The animation was produced by Fox Television Animation.

The show ran for four seasons from 2009 to 2013.

title: bartholomew_kuma
body:
[[One Piece]] character. One of the [[Shichibukai]]. A high-powered [[cyborg]] as a result of [[Dr. Vegapunk]]'s experiments, the [[Pacifista]], a high-powered combat androids, are modeled after him. He is considered a "walking mystery", with his true motivations unknown.

Having consumed the Nikyu Nikyu no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he has paw pads on his hands with the power to deflect or contain anything, which he uses in various creative ways.

[spoiler]He was formerly a commander in the Revolutionary Army and [[Jewelry Bonney]]'s adoptive father. Kuma surrendered himself to the World Government in an attempt to find a cure for Bonney's disease. In doing so, Kuma voluntarily allowed himself to be modified into a cyborg and being erased of all emotions, despite objection from Vegapunk. His memories would be later secretly allocated into his programming by Vegapunk in hope that Bonney will be capable of bringing him back to who he once was.[/spoiler]
other_names: バーソロミュー・くま

title: one_piece
body:
A [[pirate]] adventure manga and anime series drawn by [[Oda Eiichirou]] in 1997 and the best-selling manga in Japan of all time. An animated adaptation was produced by [[Toei Animation]] and a [[one piece (live action)|live action adaptation]] was later produced by [[Netflix]].

Set in a vast ocean world governed by the elusive World Government. The series follows [[Monkey D. Luffy]] and the crew of the [[Straw Hat Pirates]] in search for the titular "One Piece", a treasure said to contain a world-changing power.

The series has a spinoff called [[Shokugeki no Sanji]], itself an off-shoot of [[Shokugeki no Souma]].

title: gear_fifth
body:
A special power-up form of the character [[Monkey D. Luffy]] from [[One Piece]]. [spoilers]Technically the awakening of his devil fruit.[/spoilers] In this form, Luffy's hair and clothing turns white, his hair is now more "cloudy" in shape, and he gains a cloud ring around his head.

[Spoilers]Hito Hito No Mi, Model: Nika is a mythical zoan devil fruit which is currently possessed by Monkey D. Luffy. It enables the user to use the powers of [[Sun God Nika (one piece)|]] and it gives the user a rubber-like body. It was intentionally mislabeled as the "Gomu Gomu no Mi" by the World Government in an attempt to hide its true nature.

Its powers are limited only by its user's imagination. It can make everything they touch become rubbery or very elastic. It can also produce any element like lighting, fire, or ice if the user wants to. It can also make the user bigger or smaller at will. Effectively the user can fight as if they have "cartoon physics" not dissimilar to the ones found in American slapstick cartoons.[/spoilers]

title: metal_sonic_3.0
body:
An advanced robotic version of [[Metal Sonic]] from the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]]. Metal Sonic 3.0 was built by [[Eggman Nega]], rather than by [[Dr. Eggman]] himself. In essence, he’s a more modern, reprogrammed upgrade meant to complement—and in some respects, rival—the original Metal Sonic.

While he shares a similar body model with the original Metal Sonic, Metal Sonic 3.0 is distinguished by his different color scheme: predominantly black with yellow accents (as opposed to the classic blue of his predecessor). This difference not only sets him apart aesthetically but also ties him to Eggman Nega’s personal style.

h4. See also
* [[Mecha Sonic MkI]]
* [[Mecha Sonic MkI (8-bit)]]
* [[Mecha Sonic MkII]]

title: raiden_shogun
body:
A playable character in [[Genshin Impact]], the Electro Archon who governs Inazuma. Notable for her [[human scabbard|peculiar sword drawing technique]], in which she manifests the [[tachi (weapon)|]] [[Musou Isshin (Genshin Impact)|]] from her [[cleavage]].

Also known as Baal or "the Shogun". 

During the story, it is revealed her name is [spoiler]Ei, and her Archon name is Beelzebul[/spoiler]. The name Baal [spoiler]was a title that actually belonged to her twin sister[/spoiler]. 

Raiden Shogun has [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]], the former which is tied in a [[long braid]] and is adorned with a [[hair ornament]]. She wears a [[purple kimono]] worn [[off shoulder|hanging off her arms]], tied with a [[red sash|red]] [[obi]] and adorned with a [[shoulder armor]]. She wears [[black thighhighs]] and [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[sandals]]. Typically wields a [[katana]] called [[Musou Isshin (Genshin Impact)|]].

His signature weapon is [[Engulfing Lightning (Genshin Impact)|Engulfing Lightning]].

She is related to [spoiler][[makoto (genshin impact)|Raiden Makoto]][/spoiler], who is her [spoiler]twin sister[/spoiler].

h4. Official art

* !post #4745419

h4. See also

* [[Raiden Mei]] - Her [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]/[[Benghuai Xueyuan]] counterpart, sharing the same Japanese voice actor ([[Sawashiro Miyuki]]).
* [[Acheron_(honkai:_star_rail)|]] - Her [[Honkai: Star Rail]] counterpart, sharing the same Japanese voice actor.

h4. External links
* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Raiden Shogun":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Raiden_Shogun]

title: neon_genesis_evangelion
body:
One of the most popular anime of all time on top of being a popular [[mecha]] series, created by [[Anno Hideaki]] initially with [[GAINAX]] and now with his company [[Studio Khara]]. It has mechanical designs by [[Yamashita Ikuto]] and character designs by [[Sadamoto Yoshiyuki]]. Evangelion was first released as a TV anime series in October 1995. 

Originally planned as a parody of the traditional [[super robot]] mecha anime genre tropes at the time (according to creator Anno), it surprisingly became an extremely successful and long lasting franchise despite its mentally and socially troubled protagonists [spoilers]and Anno's original intention to troll super robot mecha [[otaku]][/spoilers].

The [b]Evangelion[/b] franchise also spans the initial manga, and many spin-offs in various media.

title: rebuild_of_evangelion
body:
A retelling of the original [[super robot]] [[neon_genesis_evangelion|anime series]] that aired in the mid 90's. 

It features new footage, animation, 3D cg, and a new female character named [[Makinami Mari Illustrious]]. It also changes [[Souryuu Asuka Langley]]'s name to Shikinami Asuka Langley.

[[Anno Hideaki]] served as the writer and general manager of the project, with Tsurumaki Kazuya, Masayuki, Maeda Mahiro and Nakayama Katsuichi directing the films themselves. [[Sadamoto Yoshiyuki]], [[Yamashita Ikuto]] and Sagisu Shirō returned to provide character designs, [[mecha]]nical designs and music respectively.
other_names: ヱヴァンゲリヲン新劇場版

title: mobile_suit_gundam
body:
A revolutionary 1979 [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] anime television series. It is the first show in the [[Gundam]] franchise.

Set in the far future, during the year [b]Universal Century 0079[/b] (79 years after the creation of the first permanent colony in [[space]]), it follows the story of [[Amuro Ray]], the teen pilot of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mobile suit]] mecha during the [[Earth Federation]]-[[Zeon]] conflict known as "The One Year War". The story of this U.C. series continues in [[Zeta Gundam]].

It was produced by [[Sunrise (company)|]], created by [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]] and "Yatate Hajime":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hajime_Yatate (a collective pseudonym for the entire Sunrise animation staff), with mechanical designs by [[Ookawara Kunio]] and character designs by [[Yasuhiko Yoshikazu]]. Tomino cited the 1959 novel [[Starship Troopers]] as an important inspiration for the show. He coined the term "[[mobile suit]]" for the show's mecha as a reference to the novel's "[[mobile infantry]]". 

The show is notable for helping to create the "Real Robot":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mecha_anime_and_manga#Real_robot genre of piloted mecha and has spanned a very successful franchise lasting over 40 years.

This tag is for the 1979 TV series and related media only. For the franchise as a whole, use the [[Gundam]] tag.

h4. Characters
* [[Amuro Ray]]
* [[Char Aznable]]
* [[Sayla Mass]]

title: para_(vtuber)
body:
French [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual youtuber]] who streams in English. Known for her love of meat despite being a bunny. 
Streaming avatar for [[wwparasi]].

She debuted on February 8th, 2023.

A [[rabbit girl]] with [[very long hair|very long]] [[light blue hair]], an [[ahoge]], and [[lop rabbit ears]] which are covered in [[blood stain|blood stained]] [[bandages]]. Her eyes are [[red eyes|red]] with [[@ @|swirls]], and she has [[hikimayu]] styled eyebrows.

Occasionally depicted as [[gyaru]] with [[tan|tanned skin]] and [[blonde hair]]. Frequently depicted as [[beer|alcoholic]]

title: window_shopping
body:
An activity in which a consumer browses through or examines a store's merchandise as a form of leisure or external search behaviour without a current intent to buy. Commonly found with [[clothes shop]]s where a [[mannequin]] is displaying clothes. Characters may have their body [[against_window|against the window]] in some way, such as a [[hand on window|hand]] or [[cheek on glass|cheek]].

h4. Examples
* !post #6519162: [[Misaka Mikoto]] [[looking at object|looking at]] a [[wedding dress]] through the [[clothes shop]] [[window]]
* !post #5924544: [[The Great Ace Attorney]] characters [[looking at food|looking at the food]] of a [[bakery]] while the pov is [[from inside]]

h4. See Also

* [[Display]]
* [[Mannequin]]
* [[Shopping]]
* [[Storefront]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Window shopping":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Window_shopping]

title: elden_ring_nightreign
body:
Standalone multiplayer co-op (PVE) action survival game developed by [[FromSoftware]].

Set in a universe parallel to the events of [[Elden Ring]], in a alternate Limgrave known as [b]Limveld[/b], the premise is that a team of three preset characters must spend three days surviving in the land, traveling while grinding experience and loot by day then by night facing off against a gauntlet of bosses, including ones from [[Dark Souls (series)|]], while a shrinking barrier of magical flames herds them towards the center of the map where they will fight one of 8 all-new final bosses to end a run.

Set to launch in May 30, 2025.

title: hizutome_rakurou
body:
The protagonist of [[shangri-la_frontier|Shangri-La Frontier]].

Hizutome Rakurou, the owner of the player character [[Sunraku (Shangri-La Frontier)|]], is a teenager of average height with [[blue_eyes|blue eyes]], [[short_hair|short]], [[blue_hair|blue hair]].

His in-game player character Sunraku is depicted as a [[topless_male|topless]] man wearing [[blue_shorts|blue shorts]] and a [[bird_mask|bird mask]], with [[scar]] like curse marks across his torso, arms and legs.

title: scar
body:
A mark left on the skin where a [[deep wound|wound]], [[cuts|cut]], burn, or other [[injury]] healed.

For the character from [[Fullmetal Alchemist]], see [[Scar (FMA)]].

Also not to be confused with the [[FN SCAR]] rifle, or either of the [i][[Girls' Frontline]][/i] [[scar-l (girls' frontline)|characters]] [[scar-h (girls' frontline)|based on it.]]

h4. Types of scars

title: eyebrow_cut
body:
An eyebrow grooming style where one or more thin vertical stripes are shaved from one or both eyebrows. Also called slits or notches.

Note that it is mutually exclusive from [[scar across eyebrow]]. An eyebrow cut is not necessarily a result of one having a scar on it.

h4. See also

* [[thick eyebrows]]
* [[forked eyebrows]]

title: surgical_scar
body: A [[scar]] resulted from the aftermath of [[surgery]]. Typically appears as long scar with [[stitches]] across it.

title: mermaid_man
body: Ernie (or Jim) Huckler, commonly known by his superhero name Mermaid Man, is a semi-retired superhero who lives in Bikini Bottom. He and his sidekick Barnacle Boy are the stars of a show-within-a-show called The Adventures of Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy, but they are also real superheroes within the [[SpongeBob SquarePants]] universe.

title: scar_across_eyebrow
body: A [[scar]] located across one's eyebrows.

title: neun_02
body: Also known as D-029, she is a gigantic wall of flesh spanning 109 yards created by [[Oliver Lobelia]]. She conceives about 33,000 to 34,000 creatures in her body. Oliver hopes to use her as as a weapon to destroy the Royal Capital. However, it turns out she doesn't want to destroy anything and is actually sapient. She befriends [[ebel alfie|Ebel]], [[enri louvre|Enri]] and [[emma white|Emma]] and allies with them to stop the Lobelia Corporation.

title: amalia_lobelia
body: Supporting character and protagonist of [[Naraku X]]. Amalia is a classmate of [[ebel alfie|Ebel]], whom she has an obsessive crush on. Is working as a spy and is a member of House Lobelia.

title: gladion_(pokemon)
body: [[Pokemon|Pokémon]] character, introducted in [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]]. Known as "Gladio" in Japan. He has [[green eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with an [[ahoge]] and [[hair over one eye|bangs over one eye]]. His signature Pokémon is [[Silvally]]. His usual attire includes [[ear piercing]]s, a [[torn shirt|torn]] [[black shirt]] under a [[grey vest|grey]] [[hooded vest]] with [[tassel]]s, and [[torn pants|torn]] [[black pants]]. He also wears [[red shoes]] , and a [[red bag|red]] [[fanny pack]] around his waist. h4. Official art * !post #5456955: [[pokemon sm|Sun/Moon]] * !post #3233290: [[pokemon sm|Sun & Moon Anime]] h4. Trivia * He works alongside [[Team Skull]] in the games and the Pokemon Adventures manga, but not in the anime. * Gladion's family includes [[Lillie (pokemon)|]], who's his sister, as well as [[Lusamine (pokemon)|]] and [[Mohn (pokemon)|]], who's his mother and father respectively. * Gladion doesn't say much, but he cares deeply about his friends, family, and Pokémon. He used to be much more rebellious and fixated on becoming stronger [tn](official bio)[/tn]. h4. See also [[Official alternate costume]]s from [[Pokemon Masters Ex]] * [[gladion (sygna suit) (pokemon)|Gladion (Sygna Suit)]] h4. title: gohei
body:
[i]Gohei[/i] (御幣), aka [i]onbe[/i] (御幣) or [i]heisoku[/i] (幣束). 

A wooden wand traditionally decorated with [[shide]] (zigzag paper streamers), though in the past it was made with rectangular strips of paper. It is used for [[Shinto]] rituals to cleanse negative energy or bless.

Notable characters with gohei include [[Hakurei Reimu]], [[Kochiya Sanae]] (who is often seen using an old-fashioned gohei with a single rectangular strip of paper on the end) and [[Yae Miko]] (who uses the more modern, zigzag paper strip gohei).

h4. See also

* [[oonusa]]
* [[haraegushi]]
* [[hamaya]]
* [[ofuda]]
* [[miko]]
* [[shimenawa]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Gohei":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gohei

title: kaiten_(weapon)
body:
The "Kaiten" (回天, literally "heaven shaker"), was a large manned suicide [[torpedo]] based of the infamous Type 93 "Long Lance" employed by the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] for suicide attacks. It is similar to [[kamikaze pilot]]s, as both were conceptualized during the late stage of [[World War II]] in a desperate attempt to slow down Allied force's advance to the Japanese home island.

It was of questionable use and exceptionally dangerous to both those handling them and the pilots; around 200 kaiten trainees, mechanics and hosts (the kaiten were fired from other ships or submarines) were killed while attempting to employ kaitens. Meanwhile, only 3 ships were sunk by the weapon.

title: diego_brando
body:
The [[Steel Ball Run]] incarnation of [[Dio Brando]], appearing as a minor antagonist. His [[stand (jojo)|]] is [[Scary Monsters (stand)|]].

When in the [[Scary Monsters (stand)|]] form, he shows a [[glasgow smile]] with [[sharp teeth]].

[spoiler]A parallel world version of Diego later appears as the final antagonist of Steel Ball Run, having [[The World]] as his original stand.[/spoiler]
other_names: ディエゴ・ブランドー

title: scary_monsters_(stand)
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Diego Brando]] and [[Doctor Ferdinand]] from [[Steel Ball Run]]. Allows the user to transform others or themselves into [[dinosaur]]s, to a various degree of similarity to the original animal. When in the latter form it's often depicted as a [[glasgow smile]] with [[sharp teeth]] on the stand user.

The namesake is [i]Scary Monsters (and Super Creeps)[/i], the 14th studio album by [[David Bowie]], released on 12 September 1980, as well as a song of the same name on said album.
other_names: スケアリー・モンスターズ

title: pikachu
body:
[[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0025 in the National Pokédex, an Electric-type.

A yellow [[mouse]]-like Pokémon, and the mascot of the [[Pokemon|Pokémon]] franchise. In the [[Pokemon (anime)|Pokemon anime]], it is the signature Pokémon of [[Ash Ketchum]]. It is voiced primarily by [[Ootani Ikue]].

Evolves from [[Pichu]], and into [[Raichu]]. It also has a [[Gigantamax]] form.

Playable in the [[Super Smash Bros.]] series.

Japanese name: [b]Pikachu[/b]

title: poke_ball
body:
Japanese name: モンスターボール (Monster Ball)

[i]You know, Poké Balls!
P-O-K-accent-E Balls![/i]

Known as a [i]Monster Ball[/i] in Japan; a spherical capsule used to capture and store [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] (Pocket Monsters). The most common and recognized Poké Ball is the titular basic variant, which has two colored halves: red on top and white on bottom. It is one of the central symbols of the franchise.

Normally, captured Pokémon are shrunken down and stored inside the ball, though some refuse to go inside the Poké Balls. [[ash ketchum|Ash]]'s [[Pikachu]] is a notable example.

Some Pokémon are noticeably similar to Poké Balls: [[Voltorb]], [[Electrode (pokemon)|]], [[Foongus]], [[Amoonguss]], [[Galarian Stunfisk]], and [[Brute Bonnet]].

[b]Note[/b]: Don't use [[ball]], [[holding_ball]] and related "ball" tags when the object in question is a Poké Ball. Simply use [[poke_ball]], [[holding_poke_ball]], etc. Don't tag [[Tera Orb]]s as Poké Balls.

body: The [[werewolf|were]][[hedgehog|hog]] form of [[Sonic the Hedgehog]], first appearing in [[Sonic Unleashed]]. A result of Sonic exposed to negative [[Chaos Emerald]] energy, he assumes the form of the Werehog at night, granting him increased strength at the cost of his speed.

title: hatsune_miku_(noodle_stopper)
body:
A FuRyu line of [[noodle stopper]] figures featuring [[Vocaloid]] [[Hatsune Miku]].

The lineup is comprised of many different designs. This tag only applies to the first design which is Miku's base design but with slightly altered [[hair ornament]]s that have extruding corners.

To search for all noodle stoppers in general, use wildcards: "*_miku_(noodle_stopper)*":[/posts?tags=*_miku_(noodle_stopper)*&z=5]

title: chuo_academy_school_uniform
body:
A [[school uniform]] in [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]], first introduced in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden|Magia Record]].

It is a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] with a [[blue sailor collar|blue]] [[sailor shirt|sailor collar]] and [[short over long sleeves]], a [[breast pocket]] and the [[school emblem]]; a [[short necktie|short]] [[blue necktie|blue]] [[necktie]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[blue skirt|blue]] [[gingham skirt|gingham]] [[miniskirt]] with [[buttons]], and [[loafers]].

title: magia_record:_mahou_shoujo_madoka_magica_gaiden
body:
[i]Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden[/i] is a smartphone game based on [i][[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]][/i]. The English version of the game ended its service on "October 30, 2020":https://magiarecord-en.com/news/?id=54966, and the Japanese version on July 31, 2024. 

An anime was "announced":https://twitter.com/magireco/status/1035863465607360512 in early September of 2018. The anime adaption is by Shaft studio with 3 seasons airing from Winter 2020 - Spring 2022. There is also a manga adaption written by Magica Quartet with art by [[Fuji Fujino]].

title: toadsworth
body:
A character from the [[Mario (series)|Mario]] franchise. He is an [[old|elderly]] [[Toad (mario)|]] who serves as [[Princess Peach]]'s steward and caretaker. He first appeared in [i][[Super Mario Sunshine]][/i] and is often seen worrying about Peach's safety and well-being, and sometimes assists [[Mario]] and [[Luigi]] on their adventures. In [i][[Mario & Luigi: Partners in Time]][/i] he also appears as [[Toadsworth the Younger]] in the past. He has a distinctive British accent and a large white [[mustache]].

title: morton_koopa_jr.
body:
Morton Koopa Jr. (also known as Big Mouth Koopa Jr.) is one of the [[Koopalings]], named after the late talk show host Morton Downey Jr. Although he is the largest of the siblings, Morton isn't as powerful as some of his other large brothers, like [[Ludwig Von Koopa]] or [[Roy Koopa]]. This may just be due to the fact that he is one of the younger Koopalings, and needs to grow some more. Morton and his brother, [[Larry Koopa]], have a star-shaped birthmark on their heads. He is also the only Koopaling to have a different skin tone rather than the yellow tone the others have.

h4. Official art
* !asset #25533109

title: lemmy_koopa
body:
Lemmy Koopa (Hip Koopa in other media) is one of the youngest of the [[Koopalings]], and the smallest. Named after [[Lemmy Kilmister]], the frontman/bassist of the English rock/[[heavy metal]] band [[motorhead|Motörhead]], he is often associated with childish traits due to his stature and personality. He retains a childlike innocence about him. Because of his traits, Lemmy is exceedingly immature; he prefers clowning around rather than conquering. He is well recgonized for his multicolored mohawk, crossed eyes, and affinity for circus balls.

h4. Official art
* !asset #25533098
other_names: レミー(スーパーマリオ)

title: iggy_koopa
body:
Iggy Koopa (also known as Hop Koopa) is one of the [[Koopalings]], named after Iggy Pop. Iggy is depicted as a demented, mechanical genius. His two main outstanding physical characteristics are his green hair (originally pink, light blue, and yellow), his glasses, as well as his thinness among the Koopalings.

h4. Official art
* !asset #25533080
other_names: イギー(スーパーマリオ)

body:
The most common [[fish]] in the [[Mario (series)|]] series, debuting in the original [i][[super_mario_bros._1|Super Mario Bros.]][/i] They hop out of the water in an arc to attack.

They have pink lips, a yellow dorsal fin that looks like a mohawk, a yellow caudal fin and their white pectoral fins look like wings. They come in a multitude of colors, with red being the default and green also being common.

title: chain_chomp
body:
A recurring enemy from the [[mario_(series)|Mario series]].

Their basic appearance is of an animate, carnivorous [[ball and chain (weapon)|]]:  a black circle or sphere with a large, [[sharp teeth|toothy]] mouth, beady eyes, and a metal [[chain]] attached opposite the mouth. The other end of the chain is typically fixed to a sturdy, immobile object.

They behave like guard dogs, lunging at any enemy in range:  their Japanese name, "Wan-wan," is an onomatopoeia for the sound a dog makes, analogous to "Woof-woof" or "Bark-bark".

They occasionally make cameo appearances in other [[Nintendo]] games.  In particular, [i][[The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening]][/i] features a friendly, domesticated Chain Chomp named [[bow wow (zelda)|BowWow]] which will attack Link's enemies.

h4. Official art
* !asset #25533058

h4. See Also
* [[Chain Chomplet]]
* [[Princess Chain Chomp]] ([[Super Crown|Super Crowned]])

title: buzzy_beetle
body:
An enemy from the [[mario (series)|Mario]] series.

They are turtle-like enemies with a powerful shell that resists fire. Some Buzzy Beetles are capable of walking along walls or ceilings, and can drop from ceilings to ambush targets. Buzzy Beetles may have a spike on their shells - these are known as [[Spike Top]]s. Other Buzzy Beetles may have white wings granting them the ability to fly (making them [[Para-Beetle]]s).

Buzzy Beetles are quadripeds. Their legs and underside are yellow, and they typically have bright red or yellow eyes. Their shells are a solid color (typically blue or black, though Spike Tops may have a red shell instead) outside an alternate color on the shell's rim (typically white).

h4. Official art
* !asset #25533046

title: bullet_bill
body:
A bullet-shaped enemy from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]]. They are generally seen fired from cannons known as [[Bill Blaster]]s, but can also simply appear out of nowhere from off screen. They have larger variants known as [[Banzai Bill]]s. Known in Japanese as simply [i]Killer[/i].

h4. Official art
* !asset #25533042

* [[Torpedo Ted]]
* [[Missile Meg]]

title: blooper_(mario)
body:
Bloopers (often referred to as Bloobers until [[Paper Mario]], though Blooper was in use beforehand) are squid-like creatures that are found in the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]]. They made their first appearance in [[Super Mario Bros. 1]], and various kinds of them have appeared in most Mario games since, normally as enemies.

Their Japanese name is ゲッソー (Gessoo) which is a pun on げそ (geso; squid legs) and officially romanized as "Gesso".

title: captain_toad
body:
One of the many [[toad (mario)|Toads]] in the [[Mario_(series)|Mario]] franchise.

First appearing in [i][[Super Mario Galaxy]][/i], Captain Toad is a [[Red Toad (mario)|Red Toad]] who leads the adventurous Toad Brigade, who seeks to help out his kingdom whenever available. A bit of a coward. 

Later got his own spinoff game, [i][[Captain Toad: Treasure Tracker]][/i]. Because of his heavy backpack, he is unable to jump.

Do not confuse him for the Toad typically used as Mario and co.'s companion.

h4. Official Art
* !asset #25532771

title: bowser
body:
The King of the Koopas, and [[mario|Mario]]'s arch-nemesis. He frequently kidnaps [[Princess Peach]] and terrorizes the Mushroom Kingdom.

[[Bowser Jr.]] is his son. The Koopalings, [[iggy koopa|Iggy]], [[larry koopa|Larry]], [[lemmy koopa|Lemmy]], [[ludwig von koopa|Ludwig]], [[morton koopa jr.|Morton]], [[roy koopa|Roy]], and [[wendy o. koopa|Wendy]], were formerly considered to be his children as well, but this has been "officially retconned by Miyamoto Shigeru since 2012.":https://web.archive.org/web/20180504092230/http://www.gameinformer.com:80/b/features/archive/2012/09/24/miyamoto-tezuka-interview.aspx

title: the_kiss
body:
An oil painting by Austrian painter Gustav Klimt, circa 1907/1908. It depicts a [[couple]] clad in [[yellow theme|predominantly yellow]], with a man [[kiss|kissing]] a [[kneeling]] woman on the cheek as her [[head tilt|head is tilted]] to the side. 

The painting has been featured in several [[fine art parody|fine art parodies]], including as the focal point of [[Elfen Lied]]'s opening.

title: the_scream
body:
"A famous 1893 painting":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Scream] by [[Edvard Munch]].

Munch recalled that he had been out for a walk at sunset when suddenly the setting sun's light turned the clouds "a blood red". He sensed an "infinite scream passing through nature". Scholars agree it was the immense eruption of the [[volcano]] Mount Krakatoa, which could be heard 5,000km away and colored skies across the world that prompted the reaction.

The agonized face in the painting has become one of the most iconic images of art, seen as symbolizing the anxiety of the human condition. Munch's work, including The Scream, would go on to have a formative influence on the Expressionist movement. And the subject of many [[fine art parody|fine art parodies]].

title: fallen_angel_(painting)
body:
An 1847 painting by French artist Alexandre Cabanel. 

In the image, a [[wings|winged]] [[Lucifer (Mythology)|]] is shown [[completely nude|fully nude]]. He is depicted [[reclining]] with an arm raised [[covered mouth|over his mouth]], and his [[interlocked fingers|fingers interlocked]]. With tears running down his face, he is seen [[crying]], with a [[furious|raging]] look in his eyes, while [[angel|angels]] fly in the sky above him.

h4. Image

* !asset #22069549


h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: The Fallen Angel":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Fallen_Angel_(painting)]

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Fine art Parody]]

title: outside_of_play_area
body:
When users of [[PlayStation VR]]s tilt their angle at a compromising position or go beyond play range (more commonly on the former), the user is greeted with a black screen (or black superimposition) and the message "Outside of Play Area" (プレイエリアの外です—Play Area [i]no soto desu[/i]).

Often used as an [[interface censor]], even for [[pantyshot]]s, to enforce modesty. The latter is a prominent case usage of the censorship, already seen in PSVR games.

There is currently no workaround for this kind of censorship.
other_names: プレイエリアの外です

title: censored
body:
When parts of the image (typically graphic or sensitive contents such as sexual organs, gore, or offensive symbolism) are obscured, typically to comply with censorship laws.

On Danbooru, this typically encompasses various Japanese pornographic materials that were censored as a result of the Japanese law. Techniques that prevent viewing sexual parts, usually [[pussy|vaginas]], [[penis]]es and [[dildo]]s but occasionally [[nipples]]. Note that the [[anus]] is not usually considered a sexual part in Japanese censorship.  

Common forms include [[mosaic censoring|mosaics]], [[bar censor|black bars]], [[blur censor|blurs]], mysterious [[light censor|white lights]], inverted colors, shaded bars, and the infamous [[invisible penis]]. [[Tentacles]] or phallic objects are commonly used to resemble genitals and generally don't need to be censored, though the point of intercourse with a vagina does. 

For obstructions that are [i]internal[/i] to the picture, like a lock of [[hair_censor|hair]] that just happens to cover the genitals, use the tag [[convenient censoring]] instead of censored.

h4. Types of censorship

* [[bar censor]]
* [[blank censor]]

Her outfit consists of a [[black_hat|black]] [[witch hat]] with a purple inner brim, black [[detached collar]] with a [[white ascot]], [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[black dress]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[detached sleeves]], [[x hair ornament]]s on her [[sidelocks|locks]], [[grey pantyhose]], and [[purple boots|purple]]-[[black boots|black]] [[gradient boots|gradient]] [[uneven legwear|uneven boots]] ([[ankle boots|ankle-length]] on her left but [[knee boots|knee-length]] on her right). 

h4. Appearance

* !post #8704047: Splash art

title: team_dim_sun
body:
The villainous organization in [i][[pokemon_ranger_2|Pokémon Ranger 2]][/i], led by Blake Hall of Altru Incorporated. Prominent members include the Sinis Trio, consisting of [[Ice (Pokemon)|Ice]], [[Lavana (Pokemon)|Lavana]] and [[Heath (Pokemon ranger 2)|]]; they are still superseded by [spoiler]Kincaid, who masquerades as a teacher in the Pokémon Ranger Academy[/spoiler].

The goal of Team Dim Sun is to awaken Darkrai and submerge all of Almia in unending darkness.

Known as [b]Yamiyami-dan[/b] in Japanese.

title: oak_casket_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]]. Voiced by [[Oonishi Saori]].

An S rank Sinner, Oak Casket is the Undertaker at the bottom level of the Drifter Camp, a Sinner with a very high affinity with death. Her alignment is Sloth.

Oak Casket has (slightly [[curly hair|curly]]/[[wavy hair|wavy]]) [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] with black [[streaked hair|streaks]], her skin is [[pale skin|pale]], she has [[heterochromia]] eyes ([[purple eyes|purple]] left, [[green eyes|green]] right), usually seen with [[purple eyeshadow]] and [[purple lips]] make-ups.

She wears a [[black robe]]/[[black dress]] with a large [[center opening]], exposing her [[large breasts]], [[stomach]] and [[navel]], the outfit itself has [[hobble dress|hobble dress skirt]]. Other clothing elements include a [[white shawl]], a pair of [[black gloves]], and a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[ankle boots]]. Usually seen with two [[handgun]]s.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21228362: Mugshot
* !asset #21228361: Default
* !asset #21228363: Phase 3 
* !asset #21228364: [[Oak Casket (Forest of Enthrallment) (Path to Nowhere)|Forest of Enthrallment]]
* !asset #25531891: [[Oak Casket (Sepulchral Ride) (Path to Nowhere)|Sepulchral Ride]]

h4. Related characters

* [[Dudu (path to nowhere)|]]
* [[Raven (path to nowhere)|]]

title: sith
body:
[quote][i]Peace is a lie. There is only Passion.
Through Passion I gain Strength.
Through Strength I gain Power.
Through Power I gain Victory.
Through Victory my chains are Broken.
The Force shall free me.[/i] - The Code of the Sith.[/quote]

A fictional [[darksider_(star_wars)|darksider]] group from the [[Star Wars]] universe.

An evil and brutal order of merciless, treacherous (even among themselves), chaotic and power-hungry murdering warriors and conquerors, the [b]Sith[/b] despise weaker lifeforms and seek only total control of the galaxy and the Force with the complete and utterly destruction of their adversaries, most notably the [[Jedi]].

Their main weapon is the [[lightsaber]], which usually has a [[red lightsaber|red colored laser blade]].

h4. Known Sith

* [[Darth Vader]]
* [[Palpatine]]
* [[Darth Maul]]
* [[Count Dooku]]

title: gundam_cross_war
body:
[b]Gundam Cross War[/b] is a collectible card game based on the [[Gundam]] franchise. 

It launched throughout Southeast Asia in October, 2015 and was available for purchase in [[Japan]], [[Macau]], [[Taiwan]], [[Thailand]], [[Singapore]], [[Indonesia]], [[Malaysia]], [[Australia]] and the [[Philippines]]. 

However, in adition to being a standard tabletop competitive card game, players could also scan the 2-D barcodes on the back of their physical cards using the Gundam Cross War app to register their cards to their [[Bandai]]-Namco account to play online.

On July 7th, 2017 it was announced that Cross War would be ending service following the release of the final booster that October. The servers for the app shut down on December 31, 2017, but card errata and official in-store tournament support were still continued into March of 2018.
other_names: ガンダムクロスウォー

title: idolmaster_2
body:
The second installment of the [[Idolmaster]]. Released in 2011 for the Xbox 360, it includes many of the original characters who are now slightly older and with new character designs.

The game also features male idols: a boy band named "[[Jupiter (Idolmaster)|Jupiter]]" handled by "961 Productions":http://961pro.jp/. The band is composed of [[Mitarai Shouta]], [[Amagase Touma]], and [[Ijuuin Hokuto]].

title: elpeo_puru
body:
(Also spelled "Elpeo Ple".) An [[orange hair]]ed young female character in Mobile Suit [[Gundam ZZ]], voiced by the late [[Honda Chieko]]. She piloted a custom [[Qubeley Mk II]] (colored purple).

It is said that she was named after a magazine called "[[Lemon People]]" (L. People), hence the odd romanization of her name.

title: linda_cube
body:
Linda Cube or Linda³ is a 1995 PC Engine CD RPG Developed by Alpha System.

Neo Kenya is facing an extinction event made by an asteroid. When the inhabitants of the world turn to a dark god, their prayers and nightmares come true.

title: ephraim_(fire_emblem)
body:
Character from [[Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones]], one of the game's main characters and protagonists. [[Eirika (Fire Emblem)|Eirika]] is his younger twin sister.

Ephraim has [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]] and [[green eyes]]. He wears a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[shirt]], a [[blue cape|blue]] [[cape]], [[white pants|white]] [[pants]] and [[brown gloves|brown]] [[gloves]]. Unlike his sister, Ephraim fights using a [[spear]].

Ephraim has been rivals with [[Innes (Fire Emblem)|Prince Innes of Frelia]] for years, and the dynamic with his best friend [[Lyon (Fire Emblem)|Prince Lyon of Grado]] is lined with mutual misunderstandings about one another.

title: shinjuku_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Pseudo-Singularity I: Quarantined Territory of Malice, Shinjuku[/b]
[quote]
When you untangle all of history, something massive must fall by the wayside.
A scenario penned by discarded madness.
Half-forgotten myths from the turn of the century.
This Pseudo-Singularity is a murder case of unprecedented scale.
The perfect crime is set in motion.
Dance through the decadent streets, you phantoms.
[/quote]
The first pseudo-singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in the [[Japan]]ese ward of [[Shinjuku (tokyo)|]] in 1999. After the events of the [[Solomon (singularity) (fate/grand order)|Solomon singularity]], several [[demon pillar (fate)|]]s escaped and created subcategory singularities, resulting in the creation of Shinjuku (among others). Here the demon pillar Baal became able to fuse phantom spirits with heroic spirits due to the Counter Force being deactivated with its separation from human history, resulting in servants who wouldn't normally exist.

Released on the Japanese server on February 24, 2017 and on the NA server on February 24, 2019. It was adapted into a manga by [[Sasaki Shounen]].

Upon release of Shinjuku (and the other pseudo-singularities), the true name of several new servants was initially hidden; however official Fate/Grand Order media would later forego keeping their true names hidden in promotional materials. Their aliases are listed below, but their true names are used on Danbooru for tagging.

title: sita_(fate)
body:
Archer-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[E Pluribus Unum (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity. [[Rama (fate)|]]'s wife, who she is cursed to remain apart from even as heroic spirits. Shares his voice actor and much of his appearance as a result of their abnormal summoning, wherein she is also considered "Rama". She is only playable in [[Fate/Grand Order Arcade]], while he is only playable in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Asai Genji]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sawashiro Miyuki]]

title: makiri_zolgen
body:
[[Matou Zouken]] in his [[aged down|youth]]. He came up with the family name Matou as wordplay for his original given name, as the second kanji in Matou (間[b]桐[/b]) can also be read as [i]kiri[/i].

His younger design first appeared in the hanafuda game for [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]] and was featured in flashbacks in the [[Fate/Zero]] anime adaptation. He later briefly appeared in the [[London (fate/grand order)|]] chapter of [[Fate/Grand Order]], with an even younger version appearing in the [[Paper Moon (fate/grand order)|]] chapter.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25531489
* !asset #25531508: [[Paper Moon (fate/grand order)|]]

title: crossbone_gundam_x-3
body:
A fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Crossbone Gundam]].

[b]XM-X3 (F97) Crossbone Gundam X-3[/b]

A prototype Gundam type [[mobile suit]] developed for the [[Crossbone Vanguard]]. 

While very similar in appearance to its brother units [[crossbone Gundam x-1|X-1]] and [[crossbone Gundam x-2|X-2]], the third Crossbone Gundam carried two powerful I-Field Generators in its shoulders, enhancing protection even further, which enabled pilot [[Tobia Arronax]] to fight extremely aggressively while remaining unharmed.
other_names: クロスボーンガンダムX3

title: matou_sakura
body:
[[Fate (series)|]] series character and one of the main characters in [[Fate/Stay Night]].

She has [[purple eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]], and a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]]. At school she wears the standard [[Homurabara Academy School Uniform]], while her casual clothes are a [[pink shirt]] and a [[yellow skirt|yellow]] [[long skirt]].

In [[Fate/Zero]], Sakura is [[Tohsaka Rin]]'s sister and the younger daughter of [[Tohsaka Tokiomi|Tokiomi]] and [[Tohsaka Aoi|Aoi]]. She was given away to the Matou family because the laws of the mage world prevented Tokiomi from training more than one of his daughters to carry on his family's tradition, and Tokiomi didn't want Sakura's potential to go to waste. However, [[Matou Zouken|Zouken]] is not really training her as a mage but instead putting her through hell. [[Matou Kariya]] made a deal with Zouken to win the Holy Grail in exchange for Sakura's freedom to return to the Tohsaka family, which he fails to do at the end of the series.

In [[Fate/Stay Night]], Sakura is [[Emiya Shirou|Shirou]]'s timid underclassman and [[Matou Shinji|Shinji]]'s adopted sister. She has been friends with Shirou since the previous summer when he was injured in an accident and she began visiting him with the excuse of taking care of him while he couldn't care for himself. Despite coming from the Matou family, Shinji claims she has been kept in the dark regarding magic as in a traditional magus household only the successor will be taught any magecraft (even though it's later revealed it's a lie and she's [[Medusa (rider) (fate)|Medusa Rider]]'s true master). Though she is respectful of her brother and defends his misconduct, he is in turn an abusive jerk towards her. Further, despite her upbeat attitude with Shirou, she is actually nearly silent and much gloomier when away from the Emiya household or Taiga and has no real friends apart from those two.

In [[Heaven's Feel]], Sakura becomes the love interest of the story and secrets about her life and the Matou family are slowly revealed.

In [[Fate/Extra CCC]], she is [[matou sakura (fate/extra)|reimagined as a new character]]. She created the AI named [[BB (Fate)]], who took her likeness and were assigned to monitor the moon. BB in turn created five Alter Ego servants collectively known as "Sakura Five", which were also modelled after Sakura.

In subsequent installments since [[Fate/Grand Order]], a number of servants (primarily those from the [[Hindu mythology]]) were manifested using Sakura's body as a vessel, therefore sharing her appearance. These servants along with BB and the Sakura Five were later collectively known as "Sakurafaces" by fanbase.

title: rice_shower_(boc'z)_(umamusume)
body:
[[Rice Shower (umamusume)|]] as ORYZA of the [[Boc'z (Umamusume)|]] unit.

She wears a [[skin tight]] [[black shirt]] with a [[single_sleeve|single]] [[long_sleeves|long sleeve]] [[bridal_sleeves|bridal sleeve]], a [[grey skirt|grey]] [[miniskirt]]. She also wears the requisite "Boc'z" [[black_hat|black]] [[baseball cap]] with  [[ears through headwear|ear outlets]]. She has no gender marking accessory since her original hat was used as such, but her hair still covers her [b]right eye[/b] just the same.

"ORYZA" is simply the genus name of [[rice]].

title: selected_ambient_works_85-92
body: Debut studio album by the British electronic music artist and producer Richard D. James under the alias of Aphex Twin.

title: fluke
body: English electronic music group formed in the late 1980s. The band were noted for their diverse range of electronic styles, including house, techno, ambient, big beat and downtempo; for their reclusivity, rarely giving interviews; and for lengthy timespans between albums.

body:
A type of tracked armoured [[military vehicle|fighting vehicle]]. Essentially a miniature [[tank]], tankettes are small, lightly armed and armored vehicle typically armed with [[machine gun]]s or a small-calibre [[cannon]]. Its primary function was to perform reconnaissance and anti-infantry roles.

Tankettes are prominently used during the interwar and [[World War II]] period before being replaced with infantry fighting vehicle (IFV).

title: bb_(fate/extra)
body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate]] character. [[BB (fate)|]] as she appears in [[Fate/Extra CCC]] and [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Appearance-wise, she looks like [[Matou Sakura]], with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. Her normal outfit is a Dracula-like [[black coat]] with a high collar, a [[white shirt]] with a large [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[high-waist skirt]] (that emphasizes her [[large breasts]]), and [[thigh boots]].

Not to be confused with [[BB (Swimsuit Mooncancer) (Third Ascension) (fate)|]]. Both wear a similar black cape, but [[BB (Fate/Extra)]] wears it with a [[high-waist skirt]], while [[BB (Swimsuit Mooncancer) (fate)|]] wears a white leotard.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Shitaya Noriko]]

h4. Appearance
* !post #4993481: [[Fate/Extra CCC]]
* !post #9152682: [[Fate/Grand Order]]

h4. See also

* [[BB (Fate)|]], for other variants
* [[List of Fate series characters]]

h4. External links

* "Type-Moon Wiki: BB":[https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/BB]
* "Fate/Grand Order Wiki: BB":[https://fategrandorder.fandom.com/wiki/BB]

title: slime_(creature)
body:
A common enemy in many RPGs. Usually represented as a blob, possibly with eyes. Sometimes, it is depicted with a [[core]], which functions similarly to the brain/heart.

It usually has the ability to melt and digest its victim's body. Because of this, it became a popular monster in JRPGs and fantasy stories, especially the [[Dragon Quest]] series.

Similar to [[tentacles]], slimes are common monsters in NSFW works, partly due to its corrosive properties being used to melt the clothes instead, and partly as a measure to avoid censorship.

For slime as a substance or with tentacles, see [[slime (substance)]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7085369

h4. See also

* [[slime girl]]
* [[slime boy]]
* [[slime (substance)]]
* [[slime sex]]

title: tentacles
body:
A tentacle is an elongated flexible organ present in animals, especially invertebrates such as [[octopus]]es. Usually, tentacles are used for feeding, feeling and grasping. In manga and anime, [[plant]]s may have tentacles as well, in the form of movable [[vines]]. And, naturally, other animals and monsters are depicted with tentacles.

Tentacles are most prominently featured in numerous Japanese NSFW works, originally as a measure to avoid having to censor a [[penis]]. In these works, tentacles are depicted as a type of fleshy [[monster]] whose body is almost entirely composed of tentacles, and they use these appendages to [[tentacle sex|the victim]] to extract the "nutrients".

title: link!_like!_love_live!
body:
The fifth entry of the [[Love Live!]] franchise, comprised of a smartphone application and [[virtual youtuber]] project, released on April 15, 2023 in Early Access, with a full release on May 20, 2023. 

Follows the Hasu no Sora Girls' High School Idol Club's activities in real time, set in [[Ishikawa Prefecture]]. It features a card game and story (written by "Mikami Teren":[https://twitter.com/teren_mikami]), as well as in-app livestreams and live performances. Character designs were handled by [[Iizuka Haruko]]. A rhythm game mode is to be added in Spring 2025.

Besides the facial expression, other indications of comical gloom include dark straight lines, a [[dark aura]], or [[hitodama]] around the character.

title: globus_cruciger
body:
The [b]Globus Cruciger[/b] (Lit. "Cross-bearing orb") is a heraldry symbol used for centuries as a symbol of Christ's dominion over the Earth and, by conscious extension, the divine right of kings. It appeared as an [[orb]] topped with a [[cross]].

 The best-known globus cruciger today is probably the English "Sovereign's Orb":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crown_Jewels_of_the_United_Kingdom#Orbs], one of the signature pieces of the crown jewels of Britain, which was parodied by [[Monty Python]] as the "[[Holy Hand Grenade]] of Antioch".

The [[Kantai Collection]] incarnation of the British battleship HMS [[Warspite (kancolle)|]] carries a black iron globus cruciger as part of her rigging (with the cross in the form of a sword with a radar antenna attached to the pommel), presumably as a reference to the crown jewels (much as her mast is designed to resemble the Sovereign's Sceptre with Cross).

The fashion brand [[Vivienne Westwood]] uses the globus cruciger as its logo and is featured in many of its designs.

h4. Example
* !asset #25530541 

h4. See also

** [[fur-trimmed cape]]
** [[red cape]]

* [[formal clothes]]

* [[shoulder sash]]
* [[throne]]
* "Wikipedia: Globus Cruciger":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Globus_cruciger]

Alternatively, it can also refer to the explosive weapon in [[Worms_(game)|]], itself a reference to the above and is essentially a more powerful version of the grenade with a fixed fuse (3 seconds or until rest), a wider AOE and a chanted "Hallelujah!" before explosion.

title: naga_(fire_emblem)
body:
Naga is an ancient being considered a god in the lore of [[Fire Emblem: Mystery of the Emblem]] (and by extention [[Fire Emblem Awakening]]), and [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]].

She is the most powerful of the Divine Dragons, the creator of legendary artifacts capable of defeating other dragons, including the [[falchion_(fire_emblem)|Falchion]].

title: worms_(game)
body:
Worms is a turn-based, artillery, strategy and puzzling game series. The goal of each game is to eliminate all Worms in each enemy's team. This goal can be achieved by using weapons to reduce the enemy Worms' energy to zero, or drown them. The match can also be won if the other team Surrenders. Each team has weapons to defeat the enemy team. The game contains normal weapons like the Bazooka, Shotgun and the Uzi, but also unusual and bizarre weapons like the Concrete Donkey, Super Sheep, Banana Bomb, etc. Utilities can also be found in game, such as the Ninja Rope, a flexible rope with more options than expected for moving Worms, the Jet Pack, and the Teleport. The players will just get a specific amount of weapons, while other weapons, utilities and additional health can be found in Crates which drop from the sky.

The game series also contains less common Schemes like Rope Racing, where the players should get from the start to the finish as fast as possible while only using the Ninja Rope. Players will use the Worm-like acrobats or Tarzan, who swings from rope-to-rope.

The series also has a few characters, such as Boggy B, Spadge, and Clagnut. There are also villains like Professor Worminkle and Boggy the Kid. However, the series' characters are almost entirely left out, since Worms focuses mostly on the missions and combat. 

https://worms.fandom.com/wiki/Worms_(series)

title: x2_(2003)
body: X2 (also marketed as X2: X-Men United, and internationally as X-Men 2) is a 2003 American superhero film directed by Bryan Singer. The film is based on the [[X-Men]] superhero team appearing in [[Marvel]] Comics. It is the sequel to [[X-Men (2000)]], as well as the second installment in the [[X-Men film series]], and features an ensemble cast including [[Patrick Stewart]], [[Hugh Jackman]], [[Ian McKellen]], [[Halle Berry]], Famke Janssen, James Marsden, Rebecca and Anna Paquin. The plot, inspired by the graphic novel God Loves, Man Kills, concerns the genocidal Colonel William Stryker leading an assault on Professor Xavier's school to build his own version of Xavier's mutant-tracking computer, Cerebro, in order to destroy every mutant on Earth and to save the human race from them, forcing the X-Men to team up with the Brotherhood of Mutants to stop Stryker and save the mutant race.

title: atf
body:
The Bureau of [b]A[/b]lcohol, [b]T[/b]obacco, [b]F[/b]irearms and Explosives (BATFE) is a domestic law enforcement agency within the [[United States|US]] Department of Justice. Its responsibilities include the investigation and prevention of the unlawful use, manufacture, and possession of [[gun|firearms]] and [[explosive]]s; acts of [[arson]] and [[bomb]]ings; including illegal trafficking of [[alcohol]] and [[tobacco]] products.

Sometimes humorously referred to as AFT after a certain US president referred to ATF as "the AFT" multiple times.

Not to be confused with [[All The Fallen]], a community for loli/shota fans.

h1. External links
* "Official website":https://www.atf.gov
* "Wikipedia: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bureau_of_Alcohol,_Tobacco,_Firearms_and_Explosives

title: original
body:
Artwork depicting a subject that isn't from any established [[howto:copyright|copyright]]. Basically, art that is not fanart.

Some art may depict original subjects alongside subjects from an established copyright, or a fan-made character of a specific copyright. In this case, the art should be tagged as original and with the tag for the copyright and apply the tag [[oc x canon]].

If the artwork shows a [i]different artist's[/i] original character, include the [[borrowed character]] tag as well.

Some works on Pixiv are occasionally tagged original by accident. Art by the character designer for an established copyright also sometimes tag their work as original — on Danbooru, these should be tagged with the corresponding copyright instead.

title: voodoo_doll
body:
[b]Voodoo dolls[/b] are [[doll]]s that are used by Houngans ([[Voodoo]] [[priest]]s) in curse rituals. It is well known that by stabbing a doll with a [[pin]], the person who is the target of the curse is hurt in the same place as the doll.

Typically, voodoo dolls are made to resemble human figure using either rags or clay. Though in many cases, it is made [[character doll|in the likeness of the victim]].

In reality, this kind of curse didn't exist in the original Voodoo. It is thought that the practice was imagined by the writer of some movie or novel. These dolls can be obtained easily as a souvenir in [[Haiti]].

h4.See also

* [[doll]]
* [[straw doll]]

title: los_angeles_police_department
body:
The Los Angeles Police Department is one of the more well-known police forces in America. Due to serving one of its major cities, their storied history (especially issues with minority communities and their frequent conflicts with inner-city criminal gangs), and proximity to Hollywood, the LAPD has been featured extensively in American pop culture in both straightforward incarnation to satire, from [[Grand Theft Auto]] to [[The Terminator]] to The Closer.

The department is headed by a Chief and operates within the jurisdiction of the City of Los Angeles. Although not the first police department in the United States to have a [[S.W.A.T.]] (Special Weapons and Tactics) unit, the establishment of it in 1967 by John Nelson and expansion under the leadership of the controversial Daryl Gates would solidify the unit into public consciousness. 

The department tasked with upholding the law, traffic control, prevention and response to crime, and providing community services. The LAPD is organized into 39 divisions and 10 bureaus to address different aspects of law enforcement.

h4. See also
* [[Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department]]

h4. External Links
* "Official LAPD Website":[https://www.lapdonline.org/]

title: rice_hat
body:
A rice hat, also known as 'asian conical hat', is a cone shaped [[hat]] made of straw or matting traditionally worn by rice harvesters in several asian countries. It is kept in place by a [[chin strap]] or an internal headband. It can be dipped in water and worn as an impromptu evaporative cooling device.

Very similiar to [[ajirogasa]], a hat made of wicker or bamboo that is worn by priests, not farmers.

A variant made of metal, wood or hardened leather worn by soldiers and samurais is called [[jingasa]].

h4. Examples

title: gyuudon
body:
A Japanese dish consisting of a [[bowl]] of [[rice]] topped with [[beef]] and onion simmered in a mildly sweet sauce flavored with dashi (fish and seaweed stock), soy sauce and mirin (sweet rice wine). It also often includes shirataki noodles, and is sometimes topped with a raw [[egg]]. A very popular food in Japan, it is commonly served with [[benishouga]] (pickled ginger), shichimi (ground chili pepper), and a side dish of miso soup. Gyuu means "cow" or "beef", and don is short for [[donburi]], the Japanese word for "bowl".

h4. See also

* Gyuudon restaurants
** [[Matsuya Foods]]
** [[Sukiya]]
** [[Yoshinoya (restaurant)]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gy%C5%ABdon

title: cross_ange_tr
body:
A game base on the anime Cross Ange. The game take place in an alternate continuity following main protagonist, Naomi, who was deceased in the anime.

Most of the pivotal events are identical to the anime, with certain changes in elements due to Naomi's appearances and expanded scenarios based on her choices throughout the game.

title: naomi_(cross_ange)
body:
Naomi is a deceased character in Cross Ange, and the main protagonist of the game Cross Ange tr. alternate continuity. Her full name is shown to be Naomi Eunice.

She is a new member of Arzenal's First Troop. During the anime continuity, she lost her life and her suit was handed down to Ange. In the game continuity, she fell into a coma before reawaken after a chance meeting with an unknown voice. She pilots the AW-CBR115 Glaive, salvaged and repaired from the parts of Coco, Miranda and Zola destroyed units.

Voiced by Sayuri Hara.
other_names: ナオミ(クロスアンジュ)

title: glory_of_deep_skies
body:
Touhou Mukyuushi ~ Glory of Deep Skies (東方夢旧市 ～ Glory of Deep Skies.) is a fan-made Touhou Project game by Τeam αlternative Σnding using the Touhou Danmakufu ph3 shooting game engine. It was programmed by Kirbio, Gizmo the Dragon, Aka Kyuketsuki, and Lunarethic. The main game features 4 stages, with three separate versions of Stage 3 that must all be cleared to unlock Stage 4, and two playable characters with two shot types each. The extra stage was released April 26th. 

https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Glory_of_Deep_Skies

title: touhou_gishinreibyou
body:
Touhou Gishinreibyou (東方偽神霊廟) is a fan-made Touhou Project script for the Touhou Danmakufu shooting game engine, directed by NRT and developed by Yuuyu, Hatsuke, and ido, the same team behind The Last Comer. It consists of 3 stages (starting at stage 4) and an Extra stage, and is based on a false prediction for the full version of Ten Desires.

The game was released in full on 29 August 2012. 

https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Touhou_Gishinreibyou

title: image_sample
body:
A [[jpeg artifacts|compressed]] or [[downscaled]] version of an image, created by a website to reduce load times or save bandwidth.

Samples should not be uploaded to Danbooru. To avoid uploading a sample, paste a link to the image on the upload page, rather than downloading the image to your computer then uploading it. Given a link to the image, Danbooru will automatically find the best-quality version of the image available.

It is Danbooru policy to either replace samples with the full-size version, or delete them if the full-size version is already on Danbooru. You can ask for samples to be replaced in topic #16765, or flag them for deletion if the full-size version is already uploaded.

Not to be confused with [[sample watermark]]s, which are promotional images with a "SAMPLE" watermark. Also not be confused with [[revision]]s or alternate resolutions of the same image produced by the artist.

h4. Types of samples

* [[pixiv sample]]
