title: wario
body:
[b]Wa[/b]rui ("わるい":[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E3%82%8F%E3%82%8B%E3%81%84#Japanese], Japanese for bad, evil, etc.) + Ma[b]rio[/b] = [b]Wario[/b]

[[Mario]]'s self-proclaimed rival. A crass, selfish, greedy anti-hero who sports superhuman strength. Frequently breaks the [[fourth wall]] in various promotional material. Partner in crime with [[Waluigi]] and stars in his own series: [[Wario Land]] and [[WarioWare]]. 

His trademark appearance is having a [[yellow shirt]], a [[yellow headwear|yellow]] [[baseball cap|cap]] with a "W" and [[purple overalls|purple overalls]]. He also has [[white gloves]], [[green footwear|green]] [[pointy shoes]], a zig-zagged [[mustache]] and a big [[pink nose]]. He used to have long sleeves, but ever since [[Wario land II]] he is now depicted with having [[short sleeves]] to emphasize his [[muscular|muscles]].

title: holocouncil
body:
[b]hololive English -Council-[/b], shortened as [b]holoCouncil[/b], is the second generation of [[hololive English]]. The lore of this generation is that each member is an avatar of a particular aspect of the universe: specifically Space, Earth/Nature, Time, Civilization, and Chaos.

Council originally consisted of [[Hakos Baelz]], [[Ouro Kronii]], [[Nanashi Mumei]], [[Ceres Fauna]], and [[Tsukumo Sana]], until the graduation of [[Tsukumo Sana]] on July 31, 2022.

Council frequently collabed with and became heavily associated with [[IRyS (hololive)|]], who debuted only one month prior. The five-plus-one members became known as an unofficial subunit dubbed CouncilRyS. Following the graduation of [[Tsukumo Sana]], the remaining CouncilRyS members were reorganized into an official unit named [[holoPromise]].

Use this tag when Bae, Kronii, Mumei, Fauna, and optionally Sana and IRyS (or their respective mascots) are deliberately grouped together. Use holoPromise when Bae, Kronii, Mumei, Fauna, and IRyS are grouped together.

h4. Examples

* !post #4723717

h4. Members

* [[Hakos Baelz]]
* [[Ouro Kronii]]
* [[Nanashi Mumei]] (graduated on April 2025)
* [[Ceres Fauna]] (graduated on January 2025)
* [[Tsukumo Sana]] (graduated on July 2022)

h4. See also

* [[holoMyth]]
* [[holoPromise]]
* [[holoAdvent]]
* [[holoJustice]]
* [[List of hololive units and subgroups]]

title: ouro_kronii
body:
A [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] who is part of [[hololive English]]'s [[holoCouncil|2nd]] [[holoPromise|generation]]. Designed by [[Wada Arco]].

Refers to herself as "Kronii Ouro". Lore-wise, she is the warden of time who can control the flow of time itself.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair|dark blue]] or [[black hair]] with blue [[colored inner hair]], [[blue eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. She also has a large clock-shaped  [[mechanical halo]], which she can use to rewind time. Her default hairstyle consists of large [[hair intakes]] that turn into [[hair flaps]] held by a [[chain headband|chain]] [[headband]] decorated with a small [[white veil]].

title: kara_no_kyoukai
body:
A series of novels by [[Type-Moon]]'s [[Nasu Kinoko]]. Kara no Kyoukai takes place in the same universe as the [[Fate (series)|]] series, and features the main character named [[Ryougi Shiki]] who possesses similar powers to [[Tohno Shiki]].

It was published before [[Tsukihime]], and is considered to be a prototypical version of the game's story. Kara no Kyoukai and [[Tsukihime]] are mutually incompatible and take place in different universes.

body: The Spinning Bird Kick (回鳥脚, Spinningu Badokyaku) is one of [[chun-li|Chun-Li's]] attacks. It is similar to [[ryu (street fighter)|Ryu]] and [[ken masters|Ken's]] Tatsumaki Senpuukyaku. title: lev_lainur_flauros
body:
A minor character in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. He is a member of [[Chaldea Security Organization]] who betrays them at the start of the story, resulting in the deaths of most of their employees and the catalyst for the incineration of humanity. He is the host to the [[Demon Pillar (fate)|]] Flauros, and commits [[suicide]] in other timelines instead of allowing humanity's destruction.

An artificial intelligence based on him appears in the [[Paper Moon (fate/grand order)|]] Ordeal Call named [b]Lainur Guison[/b].

title: doctor_doom
body:
[i]"Ms. Van Dyne, I am not some common criminal that can be distracted by your prattling. You are nothing to Doom. And your pathetic attempts to play feeble mindgames with me amount to exactly[/i] less [i]than nothing. So please, stop embarrassing yourself."[/i]
--[b]Dr. Doom,[/b] [i]The Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes[/i]

Doctor Victor Von Doom is a [[Marvel]] comics villain, ruler of Latveria, and arch-enemy of the [[Fantastic Four]]. Originally a boy from a Romani family, he witnessed his mother's death at the hands of some demons she had summoned to fight Latverian soldiers. Swearing revenge, he began to master magic and technology. Eventually, he traveled to America to study some more, and that is where he met (and eventually became foes with) [[Reed Richards]].

Due to an incident involving constructing a portal to Hell to resurrect his mother, Doom blamed Richards for the incident for causing the scars on his face. He constructed a suit of metal armor and became the cloaked tyrant scientist known today. He considers himself to be the smartest man on Earth and shows signs of politeness to his enemies. He's known for talking about himself in the third person and for having several "Doombots" that can pose as him.

Aside the Fantastic Four, Doom has faced nearly every superhero in the Marvel Universe: [[Avengers (series)|The Avengers]], [[Spider-Man]], and the [[X-Men]], to name a few.

Doom appears in various Marvel-related media, such as movies, TV shows, and video games. Among one of his most famous appearances is in the [[Marvel vs. Capcom]] series of fighting games, where he is a playable character. In Japan, his [[Fantastic Four (1967 TV series)|1967 animated version]], known as Akuma Hakase, or Dr. Demon, is fondly remembered by older fans for being a more comedic spin on the character, speaking in [[Nagoyaben]].
other_names: ヴィクター・フォン・ドゥーム

title: janggi
body: Janggi, sometimes called Korean chess, is a strategy board game popular on the Korean Peninsula. The game was derived from [[xiangqi]], and is very similar to it, including the starting position of some of the pieces, and the 9×10 gameboard, but without the xiangqi "river" dividing the board horizontally in the middle.

title: hulk
body: A [[Marvel]] superhero. A split personality of [[Bruce Banner]] created after exposure to gamma radiation. The Hulk emerges whenever Bruce is enraged, and he's usually an unstoppable force of destruction, although he's ocassionally shown to have kidness and a desire for peace deep down, and even some of Bruce's scientific knowledge.

title: bruce_banner
body: Bruce Banner, Ph.D. is a character from the [[Marvel]] universe, an American theoretical physicist, famed for his work in the fields of nuclear physics and gamma radiation. An accidental exposure to gamma radiation lead him to develop a superpowerful alternate personality called the [[Hulk]] which appears when he gets angry.

title: namor
body:
Character from [[Marvel]], although originally created in the Timely Comics era by Bill Everett.
Namor, known as the Submariner, is a half-human, half-Atlantean prince of Atlantis, who fought in World War II alongside [[Captain America]] and the original Human Torch.
He has worked for several other superhero teams, but his hatred for humanity for polluting the oceans has also lead him to clash with other heroes.

title: hawkeye_(marvel)
body:
A superhero identity in [[Marvel]] comics.
[[Clint_Barton|Clint Barton]] was the first Hawkeye (created in 1964 by [i]Stan Lee[/i] & [i]Don Heck[/i]), [[Kate_Bishop|Kate Bishop]] was the second one (created in 2005 by [i]Allan Heinberg[/i] & [i]Jim Cheung[/i]).
In the time of [b]"Dark Reign"[/b] story arc, famous villain [[Bullseye_(marvel)|Bullseye]] who was part of the [b]Dark Avengers[/b] had [[Hawkeye_(marvel)|Hawkeye]] as his public identity.

title: moon_knight
body:
[[Marvel]] superhero. His civilian name is [[Marc Spector]], but due to his dissociative identity disorder he has taken several other civilian personas, including [[Steven Grant]], Jake Lockley, and [[Mr. Knight]]. He's a ruthless vigilante who communicates with the Egyptian god Khonsu, although it might be just another voice in his head.

Moon Knight debuted into the [[marvel cinematic universe|MCU]] in his own [[moon Knight (Disney+)|Disney+ series]], where he is portrayed by [[Oscar Isaac]]. The show depicts him as far more mystical than the comics, with no ambiguity regarding the power of Egyptian gods.

title: squirrel_girl_(marvel)
body:
A [[Marvel]] character, real name Doreen Green. A girl who was born with squirrel features and ability to communicate with squirrels. Originally an obscure character, she became a fan-favourite in the internet age after her feats of defeating fearsome villains such as [[Doctor Doom]] became common knowledge. She's commonly depicted as a "meta character" who knows she's in a comic book and understands narrative conventions.

h4.External links

* "Marvel.com: Squirrel Girl (Doreen Green)":https://www.marvel.com/characters/squirrel-girl-doreen-green
* "Nicopedia":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/5333274
* "Wikipedia: Squirrel Girl":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Squirrel_Girl

title: wolverine_(x-men)
body:
[i][[X-Men]][/i] character known for his retractable [[claw (weapon)|claws]], healing factor, and adamantium skeleton.
Wolverine has been depicted as a member of [[X-Men]], X-Force, Alpha Flight, the [[Fantastic Four]] and The [[Avengers (series)|Avengers]]. The common depiction of Wolverine is multifaceted; he is portrayed at once as a gruff loner, susceptible to animalistic "berserker rages" despite his best efforts, while simultaneously being an incredibly knowledgeable and intelligent polyglot, strategist, and martial artist, partially due to his extended lifespan and expansive lived experiences. He has been featured in comic books, films, animation, and video games.  In live action, [[Hugh Jackman]] portrayed the character across ten installments of the [[X-Men film series]] produced by 20th Century Fox between 2000 and 2017, and reprised the role in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU).
h4. See also

* [[Wolverine crush (meme)]]
* [[X-23]]

title: scarlet_witch
body:
Character from [[marvel|Marvel Comics]], real name [[Wanda Maximoff]]. Originally introduced in [[X-Men]] as a villain, she would later become a member of the Avengers.
She's a mutant with the ability to control probability, which later evolved into control over the powerful Chaos Magic.
She's the sister of [[Quicksilver]], and has ocassionally been depicted as [[Magneto]]'s daughter.

スカーレットウィッチ

title: magik_(x-men)
body:
Real name Illyana Rasputina, an [[X-Men]] character and the younger sister of [[Colossus (X-men)|]]. A mutant with the power to open portals to other dimensions, she spent her childhood in a dimension known as Limbo, whose demonic ruler taught her everything about magic until she became a Sorcerer Supreme. She wields a sword that can cut through magic while leaving physical objects unharmed.

She appears in [[Marvel Rivals]]. She was portrayed by [[Anya Taylor-Joy]] in [[The New Mutants]].

title: magneto
body:
[[X-Men]] villain (occasionally also an anti-hero) who possesses supreme magnetic superpowers.
His birth name was Max Eisenhardt (a Jewish survivor of the Auschwitz-Birkenau [[concentration camp]]) before he adopted the persona of Erik Lehnsherr (a "Sinto":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinti]). He was originally the best friend of [[Charles Xavier]], but the two parted ways due to their differing stances on mutant rights; Charles opted for coexistence with humans, while Erik advocated for mutant supremacy.

title: rocket_raccoon
body:
An anthropomorphic alien raccoon character from the [[Marvel|Marvel Comics]] universe. Originally a minor and relatively obscure character, he gained fame as a member of the rebooted [[Guardians of the Galaxy]].
Known for his short-temper, expertise with guns, and ocassional reluctance to being called a raccoon.

title: groot
body:
[[Marvel]] character with the appearance of a humanoid tree. Originally introduced in 1960 as a horror monster, he was reimagined in 2006 as a benevolent alien and made into a member of the [[Guardians of the Galaxy]].
He's known for being able to speak only one phrase: "I am Groot".

title: hela_(marvel)
body: [[Thor (marvel) (series)|Thor]] villainess. Goddess of the underworld and Odin's eldest child, making her [[Thor (marvel)|]]'s sister.

title: magic_paintbrush_(mario)
body: A powerful tool from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] introduced in [i][[Super Mario Sunshine]][/i]. It was created by Professor E. Gadd, and is emblazoned with his signature logo. The brush is primarily wielded by [[Bowser Jr.]], who uses it to create graffiti, summon enemies, and manipulate the environment.

title: just_a_way_(racehorse)
body:
[[Real life|Real-life]] Japanese thoroughbred racehorse, famous for being rated the World's Best Racehorse of 2014. 

Just a Way is famous for his odd friendship with [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]], despite having contrasting personalities. In fact, he apparently has a thing for gray coats in general.

Just a Way has a brown "bay" coat with a cross-shaped white "star" and "stripe" on his face.  He also has a black mane and white "sock" markings on both his hindlegs.

Just a Way is named after the [[Gintama]] [[Justaway]] line of figurines. He was named such by his owner, Yamatoya Akatsuki, who also wrote the script for Episode 32 of [[Gintama]] (where the Justaways first appear in the animated series).

h4. See also
* [[Justaway]]
other_names: ジャスタウェイ(競走馬)

title: armlock
body:
The act of locking another persons arms above their head. In short terms, it is a move where you lock another persons arms in place. It looks a bit similar to a [[full nelson]], but unlike where a full nelson, you don't grab the neck when you perform an armlock. Do not confuse this with holding arms, which is simply put any the act of holding another person's arms.

For the grappling technique also called "armlock", see [[armbar]].

h4. See Also
* [[locked arms]]
* [[holding back]]

title: solomon_(fate)
body:
Antagonist from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Designated as the [[Grand Caster (Fate)|]]. Created modern magecraft, ushering in the Age of Man, earning the name "King of Magic" for his feat.

[spoiler]Was the Caster in the Grand/Order universe's version of the 2004 Fuyuki Holy Grail War, and his Master was [[Marisbury Animusphere]]. After winning the war and granted a chance to make a wish to the Holy Grail, the Master wished for enough funds to complete the creation of Chaldea. For the Servant, a chance to live life as a normal human being as [[Romani Archaman]]. Romani (the real Solomon) returned his gifts to God (and gave up his human life) at the climax of the first Grand Order to give the player a fighting chance to defeat [[Goetia (fate)|]] -- who had hijacked Solomon's body -- the real villain of the first Grand Order. His true appearance can be seen in post #9149017.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Sugita Tomokazu]] [spoiler]([[Goetia (fate)|]]), [[Suzumura Ken'ichi]] (true)[/spoiler]

title: list_of_digimon
body:
A list of creatures in [i][[Digimon]][/i] media, whether they are [[Digimon (creature)|]], [[Appmon]], or digital lifeforms.

[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Digimon":#dtext-digimon
** 1.1. "Baby I (Fresh)":#dtext-baby1
** 1.2. "Baby II (In-Training)":#dtext-baby2
** 1.3. "Child (Rookie)":#dtext-child
** 1.4. "Adult (Champion)":#dtext-adult
** 1.5. "Perfect (Ultimate)":#dtext-perfect
** 1.6. "Ultimate (Mega)":#dtext-ult_level
** 1.7. "Armor":#dtext-armor
** 1.8. "Hybrid":#dtext-hybrid
** 1.9. "No level":#dtext-nolevel
* 2. "Appmon":#dtext-appmon
** 2.1. "Standard":#dtext-standard
** 2.2. "Super":#dtext-super
** 2.3. "Ultimate":#dtext-ult_grade
** 2.4. "God":#dtext-god
** 2.5. "No Grade":#dtext-nograde
* 3. "Digital Lifeforms":#dtext-lifeform
* 4. "External links":#dtext-links
[/expand]

He is voiced by [[Ogata Ken'ichi]].

title: defloration
body:
[i]Not to be confused with [[menstruation]][/i]

The tearing of a girl's [[hymen]], indicating she has lost her [[virgin|virginity]].

In hentai, this is typically indicated by [[blood]] coming from the [[pussy|vagina]] during or after [[sex]], implying that the hymen has been torn and the girl has lost her virginity. In real life, the hymen is not always torn by first sexual intercourse and thus is not a reliable indicator of virginity. It can also be torn through other ways besides sex.

Use [[blood from vagina]] instead if the blood comes from an injury such as vaginal tearing rather than loss of virginity.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hymen":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hymen]

title: gundam_blazing_shadow
body:
[b]Mobile Suit Gundam: The Blazing Shadow[/b] is a [[Gundam]] series novel written by Itakura Toshiyuki. 

It was first published by [[Kadokawa]] Shoten on 25th May 2013 in the July issue of [[Gundam Ace]].

The novel is set 4 years after the end of [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]].

h4.Featured mecha
* [[Gelgoog HMT Gald Kureiz Use]]
other_names: 機動戦士ガンダムブレイジングシャドウ
ブレイジングシャドウ

title: gelgoog_hmt_gald_kureiz_use
body:
A fictional manned giant battle robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam Blazing Shadow]].

[b]MS-14B Gelgoog High Mobility Type [Gald Kureiz use][/b]

A customized repair of [[Gald Kureiz]]'s MS-14B [[Gelgoog]] High Mobility Type［Falaq] after it was damaged. 

The destroyed right arm has been replaced with an arm unit based on the MSM-07E [[Z'Gok-E]] to strengthen its power in melee combat, and a propulsion unit based on the MS-14BR Gelgoog High Mobility R Type has been equipped on the legs.
other_names: 高機動型ゲルググガルド·クレイズ機

title: white_cat
body: A [[cat]] whose fur is entirely [[white]]. Often associated with [[maneki-neko]], the Japanese lucky cat. White cats are associated with purity and are said to bring about positive changes.

title: bootleg_metal_sonic_plush
body:
A plush of [[Metal Sonic]] from the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]] famous (infamous?) for its exaggerated, off-model features. It sports very long shoes, short limbs, a disproportionately long and pointy nose, and quills that appear uneven or almost pyramid-like. Its eyes are notably elongated and squished, giving Metal Sonic an expression that many describe as unamused or oddly quirky.

Despite—or because of—its unusual appearance, the Bootleg Metal Sonic Plush has become a cult favorite within the Sonic the Hedgehog community. Videos on platforms like YouTube have associated the “hue hue hue” audio (an isolated part of [[Sonic CD]]'s JP [[Stardust Speedway]] Bad Future music track) with the plush, further elevating its status among fans and collectors. This [[meme]] originated around 2021 and gained wider attention by 2024, when content creators used clips of the plush paired with quirky audio to humorous effect, also coinciding with the character's appearance during the [[Sonic the Hedgehog 3 (film)|]] film's post-credits sequence.

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/bootleg-metal-sonic-plush-hue-hue-hue

title: jirachi
body:
A Steel/Psychic-type Mythical [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]], #0385 in the National Pokédex.

A small, white Pokémon that can grant wishes. Has [[facial mark]]s, [[black eyes]], a [[third eye]] on its stomach, and is often drawn [[floating]]. The strips of paper on its head are based off of [[tanzaku]].

title: rayquaza
body:
A Dragon/Flying-type Legendary [[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] #0384, in the National Pokédex.

A green, serpentine creature resembling an [[eastern dragon]]. Has [[yellow eyes]] with [[black sclera]]e. The mascot of [[pokemon emerald|Pokémon Emerald]], it is known for quelling the conflict between [[Kyogre]] and [[Groudon]]. A [[shiny pokemon|Shiny]] Rayquaza plays a major role in [[pokemon horizons|Pokémon Horizons]].

It can [[mega pokemon|Mega Evolve]].

h4. Official art
* !asset #25231731: Rayquaza
* !asset #25231732: [[Mega Rayquaza]]

h4. See also:
* [[Zinnia (pokemon)|]], a member of the Rayquaza-worshipping Draconid people.
* [[Sky Pillar]], the location where Rayquaza is found in [[pokemon rse|RSE]] and [[pokemon oras|ORAS]].

h4. External links
* "Bulbapedia":https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Rayquaza_(Pokémon)

Prior Pokémon: [[Groudon]]
Next Pokémon: [[Jirachi]]

title: gundam_g-saviour
body:
A [[canada|Canadian]] produced, made-for-TV, live action [[science fiction]] movie in the [[Gundam]] franchise released in [[2000]]. It is the furthest entry in the UC timeline, taking place in [b]UC 0223[/b]. The film has received negative reception from many fans due to it's stiff acting, low production values, and basic plot that lacks many Gundam staples. 

Despite the film's poor reception, it still received a number of supplementary materials, including a sequel [[video game]], prequel audio drama, and novel adaptation. The novel notably features a more "Gundam" plot, including a colony drop scene that was not in the movie, and features official illustrations by [[Suzuki Masahisa]].

While [[Bandai]] is quite negligent of this entry, it is still considered part of the UC canon, and the titular mobile suit made a cameo appearance in [[Gundam Build Fighters|Build Fighters]].

h4. Mobile Suits
* [[G-Saviour Gundam]]
* Gundam [[G3-Saviour]]
* [[I-Saviour Gundam]]

* [[Guppy (Mobile Worker)]]

* [[MS-Rai]]
* [[Bugu (G-Saviour)]]

title: barzam
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]RMS-154 Barzam[/b]

A low-cost mass production [[redesign]]ed [[one-eyed|mono-eye]] variant of the [[Gundam Mk II]] developed to replace the [[Marasai]]. Despite the reduced price, the type was extremely capable, and it was seen by many as the last true flagship multi-role [[mobile_suit|MS]] of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]].

h4. Related MS development
* [[Refined Barzam]]
* [[Barzam II]]

title: marasai
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]RMS-108 Marasai[/b]

Originally developed by [[Anaheim Electronics]] as the MSA-002 [[mobile_suit|MS]] for the [[AEUG]], pressure by [[titans_(gundam)|the Titans]] meant the [[Zeon]]ic looking type was forced into service by the oppressive elite Federation unit in mostly orange colors during U.C. 0087. While it was a comprehensive all-round improvement over the pitiful [[Hizack]], its weapon selection was much more limited, as it could only load advanced beam weapons. Later replaced by the more capable [[Barzam]] in frontline service. 

After the [[zeta_gundam|Gryphs War]] the last surviving Marasai units were acquired by [[Neo Zeon]] who used them to fill their ranks with a gray color scheme several years later. Some optimized green and grey Marasais even ended up being used by [[full_frontal|"The Sleeves"]] during their [[gundam_unicorn|Attack on Torrington Base]].

body:

A [[dinosaur]]-like creature with a red and grey body covered in [[spikes]]. Has [[claws]], [[sharp teeth]], and [[yellow eyes]] with [[black sclera]]e.

Sought after by [[Team Magma]] due to its ability to expand the continents. The mascot of [[pokemon rse|Pokémon Ruby]] and [[pokemon oras|Omega Ruby]]; its counterpart is [[Kyogre]], which it often feuds with. These feuds can only be quelled by [[Rayquaza]].

The [[Red Orb (pokemon)|]] allows it to transform into [[Primal Groudon]].

title: reactive_armor
body:
External modular armor packages used in [[tank]]s and other [[real life]] modern [[military vehicle]]s. Reactive armor actively reduces the damage a vehicle equipped with it receives, instead of passively resisting it like traditional armor.  

The most common type of reactive armor currently is [b]Explosive Reactive Armor[/b] ([b]ERA[/b]), which will detonate when penetrated and impair or deflect the incoming projectile.  This type of armor appears as tiles or plates fitted on top of the normal armor of the vehicle equipped with it. Once their protective surface is spent they can be removed to save weight.

This system is also featured in several [[mecha]] from realistic sci-fi anime and manga.

h4.See also

title: tiamat_(fate)
body:
A major antagonist in [[Fate/Grand Order]], appearing only in the Babylonia Singularity of the game and the accompanying anime. The Primordial Mother who created the world, but was betrayed by her children. She went mad out of grief and attempted to replace humanity with a new species called the [[Lahmu (fate)|]].

Introduced as a playable Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order Arcade]], under the Alter Ego class, as [[Larva Tiamat (fate)|]].

title: bianca_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Bianca[/b], known as [b]Bel[/b] (ベル) in Japan, is a character introduced in [[pokemon bw|Pokemon Black and White]]. Not to be confused with [[bianca (pokemon heroes)|a character of the same name]] from [[pokemon heroes: latios & latias|Pokémon Heroes]].

Bianca is a Trainer who once traveled across the Unova region. She loves Pokémon and currently works as an assistant to [[aurea juniper|Professor Juniper]] to learn more about them [tn](official bio)[/tn].

She has [[green eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]]. She initially wears a [[green headwear|green]] [[beret|hat]], a [[short sleeves|short-sleeve]] [[white dress|dress]], an [[orange vest]] and [[orange pantyhose|pantyhose]], [[yellow footwear|yellow]] [[flats]], and carries a [[green bag|green]] [[shoulder bag|bag]] with the [[strap between breasts|strap between her breasts]].

In [[Pokemon BW2|Black 2 and White 2]], she dons a new outfit including a hat [[hat bow|with]] a [[white bow]], [[red-framed eyewear|red]] [[semi-rimless eyewear|semi-rimless]] [[glasses]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[v-neck]] shirt, an [[open jacket|open]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[orange jacket|orange]] [[hooded jacket|jacket]], [[green pants|green]] [[capri pants]], and [[orange footwear|orange]] [[ankle boots]].

Voiced by [[Taketatsu Ayana]].

title: gorgon_(fate)
body:
The fully monstrous Avenger-class form of [[Medusa (fate)|]], first appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Babylonia (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity.

Like Medusa, she has [[purple hair]], [[very long hair]], a [[blindfold]], with [[huge breasts|much bigger breasts]]. In addition, she gains [[monster girl|monstrous qualities]] such as [[claws]], [[scales]], [[snake hair]], [[square pupils|square]] or [[slit pupils]], and, in her final form, [[wings]]. Her outfit consists of a black or white [[bustier]], with a [[cleavage cutout]] and a long skirt with a [[pelvic curtain]], leaving the midriff and [[navel]] exposed.

Her Noble Phantasm, [[Pandemonium Cetus]], fully transforms her into a [[monster]] form that first appeared in flashbacks of [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]].

title: black_rose_(sonic_prime)
body:
A character from the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]], introduced in [i][[Sonic Prime]][/i]. She is a variant of [[Amy Rose]], hailing from the No Place dimension. Unlike the original Amy Rose, who is recognized for her cheerful demeanor and affection toward [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]], Black Rose embodies a swashbuckling pirate persona.

Black Rose shares Amy Rose's core physical traits as a pink-furred anthropomorphic hedgehog with light green eyes and peach skin. However, her pirate-inspired attire sets her apart. She wears a dark brown bandana, a vest, and other clothing that complements her seafaring lifestyle, giving her a distinct and rugged look suited to her role as a pirate captain.

title: sonic_the_hedgehog
body:
One of the most iconic and instantly recognizable figures of pop culture in entertainment. Starring in several cartoons and anime, movies, a hit video game series, and holds the record for the longest running comic book series based from a [[video game]] franchise. 

The main hero of the [[Sonic (series)|]] franchise, [b]Sonic the Hedgehog[/b] is a blue-colored hedgehog who can run at extremely fast speeds, and has a upbeat personality with a smarty-pants attitude while always looking forward to adventures. He loves chili dogs and rock music. He makes friends easily, but will equally not forgive anyone who threatens his friends and the world. His long-time nemesis is [[Dr. Eggman]], but they seem to uphold their rivalry on decent terms. Sonic can also change his form state, by collecting all 7 of the [[Chaos Emerald]]s and harnessing their positive energy to transform into Super Sonic; which bears a striking resemblance to a [[Super Saiyan]] from the [[Dragon Ball Z]] universe. This in turn grants him exponential speed and power increases, among flight abilities also making him immune to most attacks. 

Sonic was designed and created by Japanese artist and game designer "Oshima Naoto":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naoto_%C5%8Cshima. He was initially codenamed "Mr. Needlemouse" during development as Sega's new mascot and was originally colored teal. His trademark blue pigmentation was chosen later to match Sega's cobalt blue logo. "Uekawa Yuji":http://sonic.wikia.com/wiki/Yuji_Uekawa provided the revamping of Sonic The Hedgehog's art style with the shift to the 3D era with the [[Sonic Adventure]] games around 1998.

Sonic replaced [[Alex Kidd (character)|Alex Kidd]] as the official mascot of [[SEGA]] Corporation since 1991.

Voiced by Kanemaru Jun'ichi in Japan, and Jaleel White, Martin Burke, Ryan Drummond, Jason Griffith, and Roger Craig Smith in North America.

title: steven_boxleitner
body:
A character from the [[WordGirl (series)|WordGirl series]] who initially appears as a kindly, if absent‐minded, scientist. While testing a device intended to read rodent minds, he becomes inadvertently fused with an evil lab mouse named [[Squeaky (WordGirl)|Squeaky]].

As a result of this fusion, Boxleitner transforms into the villain [[Dr. Two-Brains]].

title: shiono_nagisa
body:
Character in [[Kateikyoushi no Onee-san]].

Shiono Nagisa is a laid-back, carefree Math teacher who is hired by [[Sakura Touya]]'s father to tutor his son, alongside her colleages [[Akizuki Sara]], [[Amemiya Amane]], and [[Onodera Rio]]. She is particularly notorious in the OVA adaptation for [[wrestling]] Touya whenever he gets a question wrong.

She is a young, voluptuous woman with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[black eyes]], typically wearing a [[white camisole]] with black [[denim shorts]] and a black [[choker]].

title: chaos_sonic
body:
A character introduced in the animated series [[Sonic Prime]]. He is a [[robot]] created by [[Mr. Dr. Eggman]], the leader of the Chaos Council, designed to imitate and surpass [[Sonic the Hedgehog]]. Chaos Sonic's appearance mirrors Sonic's, featuring a dark blue, slender robotic body with elongated limbs, yellow accents, and red shoe-like feet. His head includes faux quills and ears, with a glowing cyan screen displaying his red "eyes."

title: onodera_rio
body:
Character in [[Kateikyoushi no Onee-san]].

Onodera Rio is a kind, but flustered, teacher who is hired by [[Sakura Touya]]'s father to tutor his son, alongside her colleages [[Akizuki Sara]], [[Amemiya Amane]], and [[Shiono Nagisa]]. Unlike her colleagues, Rio is not a professional teacher and is instead training to become one.

She is a young woman with [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]], typically wearing a [[suit]] with a [[skirt suit]] when teaching, though she instead wears a [[white camisole]] with a [[yellow skirt]] when in casual situations.

title: cristiano_ronaldo
body:
[b]Cristiano Ronaldo dos Santos Aveiro[/b] (b. 5 February 1985) is a [[Portugal|Portuguese]] [[soccer|footballer]], renowned around the world as one of the best strikers of all time since his time at [[Manchester United]], helping his team win a Champions League title in 2008, and that season being honored as the [[FIFA]] World Player of the Year. He has also played for [[Real Madrid]], and [[Juventus FC]], and has received numerous awards and championship titles.

During the end of his career, he played at the Saudi club Al-Nassr (which is funded by Saudi crown prince Mohammed bin Salman). He would be added as a guest character in [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]] (the developers, [[SNK]], is currently almost entirely owned by bin Salman's foundation).

He is frequently paired with fellow striker [[Lionel Messi]] due to their rivalry as the best player in the world during their prime.

She is a young woman with [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]], with bangs [[hair over one eye|covering one of her eyes]]. title: t-34
body:
The [b]T-34[/b] was a [[Soviet]] medium [[tank]] that had a profound and lasting effect on the field of tank design as it spawned the concept of what is nowadays known as modern Main Battle Tanks or MBTs.

Although its armour and armament were surpassed later in the war, it has been often credited as the most effective, efficient, and influential tank design of [[World War II]] due to its multiple innovations. More than 80,000 T-34s and its variants were produced by the Soviet Union during WWII, making it the most produced tank of the whole war. Because of this some experts have even declared that the T-34 is "the tank that saved the Soviet Union".

At its introduction, the T-34 possessed an unprecedented combination of firepower, mobility, speed, protection, and ruggedness. Its 76.2 mm (3 in) high-velocity tank gun provided a substantial increase in firepower over any of its contemporaries; its heavy sloped armor was difficult to penetrate by most contemporary anti-tank weapons. Its engine was small and efficient, also providing very high speed and a long autonomy and range. However, this come at the cost of atrocious crew ergonomics as the crew of four (later five in the late [[T-34-85]] variant) were tightly packed in frontal compartment.

title: m4_sherman
body:
The [b]M4 Sherman[/b] (named for the [[American Civil War]] General "William Tecumseh Sherman":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Tecumseh_Sherman ) was the primary [[tank]] used by the U.S. during [[World War II|World War II]]. Tall, fast, versatile, moderately armored, with a sloped glacis and a rounded turret housing a 75mm or 76mm gun, the reliable M4 saw worldwide use in both the Pacific (where it excelled) and the European theaters of the war.

While the tank proved to be quite superior against the light armor used by the [[Imperial Japanese Army]] in the Pacific, the much heavier and potent tanks of the German [[Wehrmacht]] became very dangerous foes for the Sherman, which was even nicknamed "The Tin Coffin" or "The Coffin on Tracks" by American crews operating it in the European theater. 

Nevertheless, its superior numbers and the fact that it was very easy to produce (in vast numbers), maintain, repair and modify (European crews eventually added extra armor and more potent anti-tank armament) proved crucial for the American war effort and made the Sherman tank a very successful combat machine design in the end.

More extensive modifications undertaken during the [[Cold War]] - specifically, the fitment of the [[AMX-13]]'s turret and gun on the M4 chassis by Egypt, and the addition of more powerful engines and a tweaked 105mm F1 gun taken from the [[AMX-30]] by Israel (the later receiving the designation of M-51 or Super Sherman) gave the old design a new lease of life decades after its retirement, proving the tank's capabilities could be expanded much further beyond its original specifications.

h4. Some variants

* [[M4A3E2 Jumbo]]
* [[M4A3E8]] "Easy Eight"
* [[Sherman Firefly]]
* [[T34 Calliope]]
* [[M50 Super Sherman]]

title: myaku-myaku
body: The official [[Expo2025]] [[logo]] and its associated mascot. Also known by the fan nickname "Inochi-no-kagayaki" (いのちの輝き, "the brilliance of life"), one of the original design concepts of the logo. The logo consists of red circles and ellipses resembling living cells arranged into a circle shape. The internet, however, understood it as a [[blue eyes|blue-eyed]] [[eldritch abomination|otherworldly]] [[creature]]. Also known as コロシテくん Koroshite-kun, which means "Kill Me-kun". h4. See also * "SCP-066":[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-066] * [[Tower of the Sun]] h4. External links * Expo2025 official character page

title: expo2025
body:
A World Expo held in [[Osaka_(city)|]], Kansai, Japan.

"The logo":[https://www.expo2025.or.jp/en/overview/logomark/], nicknamed "inochi-no-kagayaki" and created by graphic designer Shimada Tamotsu, has become a talking point on Japanese Twitter due to its mascot-like, albeit [[eldritch abomination|eldritch]], design. This contrasts the other "top five entries":[https://www.expo2025.or.jp/en/news/news-20200825/] which were more abstract and stereotypical of a logo. This has spawned parodies interpreting the logo in a variety of ways, ranging from cute mascot to clothing motif to horrifying monster.

A mascot character based on the aforementioned logo was also created, which was "named":[https://twitter.com/expo2025japan/status/1549008586218655745] [[MYAKU-MYAKU]].

h4. Further reading:
* "Osaka Chooses Googly-Eyed Logo for Expo 2025 and It’s an Obvious Choice (Spoon & Tamago)":[https://www.spoon-tamago.com/2020/08/25/osaka-expo-2025-logo/]
* "The logo for Osaka's Expo 2025 has been revealed – and it's a little surreal (TimeOut)":[https://www.timeout.com/tokyo/news/the-logo-for-osakas-expo-2025-has-been-revealed-and-its-a-little-surreal-082520]

h4. See also
* [[Expo2005]]
* [[Tower of the Sun]] -  Expo'70, Osaka
* [[Cosmo Hoshimaru]] - Expo'85, Tsukuba

title: sword_knot
body: Sword knots are decorative cords or straps that are attached to the hilt of a sword. They are used to help secure the sword to the wielder's wrist while in use, preventing the sword from being dropped or knocked out of the hand during combat. Sword knots are often made of braided leather or silk and can be intricately designed with tassels, fringe, or other embellishments. In addition to their practical function, sword knots also serve a ceremonial or decorative purpose, adding a touch of elegance to the overall appearance of the sword.

title: yasuke
body:
[b]Yasuke[/b] was the Japanese name given to a black slave who was brought by Jesuit priests to Japan, where he caught the interest of [[Oda Nobunaga]], who had never seen a black man before, and made Yasuke his retainer, making him the first known foreign born samurai. Yasuke served Nobunaga from 1581 until 1582 when Nobunaga died after being betrayed by one of his generals, [[Akechi Mitsuhide]]. Yasuke fought with Oda's loyalist forces against the Akechi rebels before being captured and sent back to the Jesuits where his fate after that remains unknown.

h4. See also

* [[Yasuke (Anime)]]
* [[Yasuke (Assassin's Creed)]] ([[Assassin's Creed: Shadows]])
* [[Yasuke Simulator]]
